Description du poste
Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Data GCP (Google Cloud Platform) pour rejoindre notre équipe en pleine expansion.

Dans ce rôle clé, vous serez responsable de la gestion, de l’optimisation et de la mise en œuvre de solutions de données sur GCP, contribuant ainsi à des projets de transformation numérique stratégiques.

Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec des architectes, des data scientists et des équipes de développement pour construire des architectures de données scalables, sécurisées et performantes.

Vos missions :

Conception et déploiement de solutions cloud : Concevoir, déployer et maintenir des solutions de données robustes sur Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, etc.).
Gestion des pipelines de données : Mettre en place et automatiser des pipelines d’intégration de données, de traitement et de transformation en utilisant des outils GCP et des technologies associées.
Optimisation des performances : Assurer la performance, l’extensibilité et la sécurité des infrastructures de données sur GCP.
Collaboration et support : Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes internes pour comprendre les besoins métiers et fournir des solutions de données adaptées. Apporter un support technique aux équipes de développement et de data science.
Veille technologique : Se tenir informé des dernières tendances et innovations sur Google Cloud, en particulier dans le domaine de la gestion de données et du machine learning.
Gestion de la qualité des données : Mettre en œuvre des processus pour assurer la qualité, l’intégrité et la sécurité des données au sein de l'infrastructure GCP.
Automatisation et infrastructure as code : Utiliser des outils comme Terraform, Cloud Deployment Manager pour automatiser la gestion de l’infrastructure GCP.

Qualifications
Maîtrise des technologies GCP (Google Cloud Platform) telles que BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, etc. 
Compétence avérée en Python pour le développement de pipelines de données, l'analyse et la manipulation de données. 
Expérience avec les outils de visualisation de données comme Looker, pour la création de tableaux de bord et de rapports. 
Connaissance approfondie des concepts SQL et de sa mise en œuvre pratique. 
Capacité à travailler avec de grands volumes de données et à optimiser les performances des requêtes. 
Compréhension des architectures de données distribuées et des concepts de traitement de données en temps réel. 
Excellente communication écrite et orale : Aptitude à produire des livrables et des reportings de haute qualité. 
Esprit d'analyse et d'amélioration continue : Capacité à évaluer le code et ses impacts, ainsi qu'à remettre en question les solutions existantes pour les améliorer. 
Capacité de prise de recul : Aptitude à évaluer les problématiques avec objectivité et à proposer des solutions d'amélioration. 
Esprit d'équipe : Capacité à collaborer efficacement avec les membres de l'équipe pour atteindre des objectifs communs. 
Maîtrise des concepts d’Agilité (Scrum, Sprint Planning, Backlog…). 
Sens aigu du détail et de la rigueur dans la conception et l'implémentation de solutions de données. 
PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

Diplômé(e) d’un Bac+5 en école d'ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire avec une spécialisation en informatique, ou justifiant d'une expérience significative équivalente 
Expérience de plus de 7 ans en GCP 
Une expérience dans le secteur du commerce de détail ou de la grande distribution serait un plus.

job_description:

Description du poste
Nous recherchons un Développeur Tableau passionné et expérimenté pour rejoindre notre équipe de Business Intelligence. Vous aurez la charge de la création, du développement et de l'optimisation des dashboards et rapports interactifs en utilisant Tableau, afin d’aider les équipes métiers à prendre des décisions basées sur des données fiables et pertinentes. En tant que membre clé de notre équipe, vous participerez à l'évolution de notre plateforme de données, en collaboration avec des data analysts, des data scientists et des chefs de projet.

Missions :

Conception et développement de dashboards : Concevoir et développer des tableaux de bord interactifs, des rapports et des visualisations percutantes sous Tableau, adaptés aux besoins des utilisateurs métiers.
Analyse des besoins : Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de reporting et de visualisation de données, et traduire ces besoins en solutions Tableau efficaces.
Optimisation des performances : Optimiser les performances des tableaux de bord, des calculs et des sources de données afin de garantir une expérience utilisateur fluide.
Gestion des sources de données : Préparer et intégrer des données provenant de différentes sources (bases de données, API, fichiers Excel, etc.) pour les rendre accessibles et exploitables sous Tableau.
Automatisation et gestion des flux de données : Mettre en place des automatisations pour l’actualisation des données et garantir la cohérence des rapports.
Support et formation : Apporter un support technique aux utilisateurs finaux, leur fournir des formations sur l’utilisation des dashboards Tableau et résoudre les problèmes techniques rencontrés.
Veille technologique : Rester informé des nouvelles fonctionnalités et des meilleures pratiques liées à Tableau, et proposer des améliorations continues sur la plateforme.

Qualifications
Profil recherché :

Formation : Bac +5 en informatique, Data Science, Business Intelligence ou domaine équivalent.
Expérience : Minimum 3 ans d’expérience dans le développement de visualisations de données et de rapports sous Tableau.
Compétences techniques :
Maîtrise de Tableau Desktop et Tableau Server (création de visualisations, calculs, filtres, etc.).
Expérience avec des bases de données SQL et capacité à concevoir des requêtes complexes pour alimenter Tableau.
Connaissance des bonnes pratiques en matière de design de visualisations et de storytelling avec les données.
Expérience avec Tableau Prep ou d'autres outils ETL est un plus.
Connaissance des intégrations Tableau avec des systèmes externes (API, outils BI tiers).
Compétence en gestion de versions avec Git ou d’autres outils similaires est un plus.
Aptitudes personnelles :
Esprit d’analyse et capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes.
Excellentes compétences en communication, à la fois techniques et non techniques, pour interagir avec les équipes métiers.
Autonomie, organisation et gestion des priorités dans un environnement dynamique.
Sens du détail, créativité et capacité à transformer des données brutes en insights visuels pertinents.

Informations complémentaires
Le poste est ouvert pour les villes : Rabat ou Casablanca

Informations contractuelles

Job Description
Location


Morocco
Location Type


Remote
Who we are is what we do.


Deel and our family of growing companies are made up of global teams dedicated to helping businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily.
The team comprises over three thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 100 countries, and our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the platform and products for customers.
Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the platform’s success. We deliver the best products and features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.
A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because exceptional talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.
We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.
After our successful Series D in 2021, we raised another $50M in 2023, doubling our valuation to $12B. There’s never been a more exciting time to join Deel — the international payroll and compliance market leader.
Responsibilities:


We are looking for a proactive Junior Finance Analyst with a strong data orientation to contribute to our financial analysis and reporting processes. Your responsibilities will encompass:
Data-Driven Insights: Extracting actionable insights from extensive and intricate data sets, enabling informed decision-making.
Workflow Development: Creating efficient data processing workflows to enhance our reporting capabilities and streamline data accessibility.
Data Structuring for Efficiency: Assisting in structuring data to optimize the efficiency of extracting pertinent business information.
Data Auditing and Resolution: Auditing data to identify and resolve potential data quality issues, collaborating closely with the Data team to ensure swift resolution.
Proactive Reporting: Proactively providing actionable reports to business stakeholders based on data analysis, aiding in strategic decision-making.
Analytical Problem-Solving: Conducting thorough analytical deep-dives to analyze and resolve complex financial problems effectively.
Financial Modeling: Assisting in the creation of financial models to forecast relevant KPIs for the Finance department, contributing to strategic planning.
skills:
Skills:


To succeed in this role, you should possess the following skills and qualifications:
SQL Proficiency: Fluent in SQL for efficient data querying and manipulation.
Excel and Analytical Skills: Excellent command of Excel and strong analytical capabilities for data interpretation.
Data Analysis Experience: Minimum of 2 years in a similar data analysis function.
Financial Acumen: Solid understanding of P&L and Cash-Flow concepts.
Project Management in a Fast-Paced Environment: Experience handling multiple priorities and projects within a dynamic setting.
Proactivity and Autonomy: Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects independently, knowing when to escalate issues or seek support.
Communication and Data Presentation: Strong communication skills with the ability to present data effectively to various stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail and a willingness to delve into analytical investigations.
Educational Background: Preferred, minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
This role presents an exciting opportunity for a budding finance professional with a strong inclination towards data-driven analysis and reporting.
Note: This job description outlines the general nature of work and is not exhaustive in listing all responsibilities, duties, and required skills.
Total Rewards


Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.
Some things you’ll enjoy


Provided computer equipment tailored to your role
Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
The flexibility of remote work, including WeWork access where available

Job Description:


Join our dynamic Quote Associate team at Arrow! Our team is built on a foundation of collaboration, trust, friendliness, and positivity. If you speak English and enjoy working with others, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!
As part of our company´s growth, ARROW Morocco is strengthening its teams and is looking for a Quote Associate. We have currently a team in Casablanca where the atmosphere is friendly, sociable and positive.
As a Quote Associate, your role will be maintaining and providing support of foundational data elements including items, pricing, authorizations and customer related information. This individual will work across Arrow Global Components teams providing problem resolution and ongoing expertise to support operational excellence.
As Arrow Global Components (AGC), a part of Arrow Electronics, we are a leader in distribution and value-added services related to electronic components. We resell, customize, and distribute electronic components to our clients all over the world. Our business is based on a trusted, long-lasting net of relationships with industry leaders, both on the supplier and customer side.
· New quote support & maintenance for Costing & Strategic Tenders.
· Pricing and special price handling for designated suppliers and/or Technologies
· New part creation / set-up into Arrows’ ERP system.
· Quote renewals for all quoting types.
· Admin support for annual pricing negotiations.
· Supplier quote support for designated Suppliers.
· Upload of pre-negotiated prices into the system.
· English on min B2 level (both spoken and written), additional language is an asset.
· Good knowledge of MS Office, Excel is a plus.
· Customer Service, Order Management or Sales experience.
· Accountability.
· Communication and coordination skills.
· Customer-oriented attitude.
· Team player.
· Some experience in product marketing, pricing, purchasing, sales or customer service.
· Experience on the Electronic Components and/or Power Supply's Industries.
· Interest in new technologies.
· Good communication and negotiation skills.
· Full Permanent contract,
· Social advantages: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance,
· Very good working atmosphere in a team of passionate collaborators,
· Work culture where you can make an impact,
· Dynamic environment with a friendly work atmosphere,
· Interesting career development opportunities in a quickly growing environment,
· Working within an international organization, recognized worldwide in its sector.

Des missions stimulantes, un impact tangible, une proximité client exceptionnelle – et tout cela dans un cadre qui dépasse les frontières de l'audit traditionnel. Es-tu prêt(e) à faire bouger les lignes ? BAS t'attend !

job_description:
Job Description
Cookie management for the best digital experience
Withdraw your consent at any time by clicking “Cookie preferences” in the footer on our website. Learn more in our and . APM Terminals
Opportunity


APM Terminals is a port infrastructure leader, uniquely positioned to help both shipping line and landside customers grow their business and achieve better supply chain efficiency, flexibility, and dependability.
Part of A.P. Moller-Maersk, we leverage more than 100 years of industry experience to design and build high-quality container terminals.
Purpose


This position is responsible for monitoring and analyzing operational performance metrics to ensure efficient and effective container terminal operations. It involves conducting data analysis, identifying operational bottlenecks, and providing actionable insights to enhance overall performance and productivity.
Principal Accountabilities


Monitor the performance using dashboards and Power BI, ensure they run efficiently and meet user needs. Customize dashboards to meet specific user or departmental requirements, providing tailored solutions that enhance decision-making processes. Develop and implement automation scripts to reduce manual data processing and increase efficiency. Integrate Power BI with other business systems and tools to streamline data flow and improve reporting capabilities. Conduct thorough testing and validation of dashboards and datasets to ensure accuracy and reliability. Collaborate with different business units to understand their needs and provide customized reporting solutions. Perform trend analysis and forecasting to support strategic planning and decision-making. Apply advanced analytical techniques such as machine learning and statistical analysis to uncover deeper insights. Build and maintain strong relationships with port authority to ensure their reporting needs are met. Provide regular updates and reports to finance department on dashboard performance and enhancements. Function as the main point of contact with other shipping lines for billing-related issues. Compilation of reports for stakeholders, encompassing both internal and external audiences.
Who we are looking for


Masters/engineering degree in Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field Proven experience in performance analysis, data interpretation, and process optimization within the container terminal or logistics industry. Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner. Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Possess effective analytical, numeracy, reporting and problem-solving skills. Mast have a proactive approach to improving systems and procedures that will improve operational efficiency.
Critical Skills


Planning and Organizational Skills Lean knowledge Performance analysis & data interpretation Collaboration Customer Centricity Problem Solver mindset
You have been reading so far, we’re glad to see you are interested. If you could see yourself in this role and you are keen to be part of the journey to establish a world-class function at APM Terminals, we look forward to hearing from you!
#LI-HE1
#LI-POST
Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.
We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com .

job_title: HR - Senior Associate career process optimization and insights - Casablanca
job_description:
Job Description
About us

Infomineo is a fast-growing business insights provider, bringing Brainshoring to global clients across a range of services: Business research, Content Services, Graphic Design, and Data Analytics. Our clients include leading Consultancies, Fortune 500 companies, Governments, and NGOs. Infomineo counts 350+ employees spread across 5 offices covering EMEA and the Americas (Casablanca, Cairo, Dubai, Barcelona and Mexico City). 

About this Role

In this role, the Senior Associate Career Process Optimization & Insights will be the go-to person for data analytics, process improvement, and project coordination—ensuring that high-value initiatives run smoothly. While you’ll collaborate on strategic topics, the final decisions and ownership remain at the senior leadership level. You will support the Director and senior team members in designing and executing programs related to career frameworks, succession planning, performance management, employee engagement, and internal mobility.

What will you do?

Process Improvement & Innovation

Contribute ideas for streamlining and digitizing existing career management processes (e.g., automating career committee, surveys, reducing manual data entry, etc.).
Partner with internal IT/Teach teams or external vendors to test and implement new performance management and HR tech features or integrations, under the guidance of senior team members.
Research and recommend best practices or emerging tools in talent management, ensuring Infomineo stays at the forefront of industry developments.
Analytics & Reporting

Gather, analyze, and interpret data on performance, succession, internal mobility, and engagement metrics.
Create user-friendly dashboards and reports (Excel, Power BI, etc.) for senior leadership review.
Collaborate with the Director to identify trends, potential gaps, or optimization opportunities in talent pipelines.
Proactively flag potential risks or resource constraints, offering recommendations to keep initiatives on track.
Project Coordination & Support

Develop project timelines, coordinate stakeholder meetings, and track milestones to ensure timely completion of deliverables.
Assist in planning and executing performance review cycles, career internal mobility initiatives, and high-potential programs.
Act as a central point of communication, disseminating project updates to relevant departments.
Employee Engagement & Communication

Liaise with department heads, and other teams to facilitate program rollouts (e.g., refresher sessions, sharing guidelines).
Prepare clear, concise communication materials and campaigns (e.g., email announcements, internal communication, FAQs sessions) to support program adoption and understanding. (Eg, career development initiatives, high potential programs, and internal mobility opportunities).
Collect feedback through surveys or focus groups from managers and employees, escalating any significant issues or recommendations to the Director.
Performance Management & Internal Mobility

Work closely with managers/PDCs and Heads to coordinate performance review cycles, calibrations, and career discussions.
Facilitate career internal mobility processes—posting roles internally, gathering applications, and supporting the selection and placement steps—while keeping accurate records.
Who you are?

Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
3–5 years of relevant project coordination, analytics or HR preferably in talent management, career development, or organizational development contexts.
Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets (pivot tables, dashboards, data analysis).
Exposure to HRIS systems (e.g., Odoo) or talent management platforms
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana) is a plus.
Strong verbal and written English. French or Arabic proficiency is advantageous (depending on location/team mix).
Experience tailoring communication to multiple audiences (e.g., senior leaders, junior employees).
Key competencies:

Analytical & Data-Driven: Skilled at transforming data into actionable insights.
Project Management: Highly organized, able to prioritize multiple initiatives, and meet deadlines.
Process Improvement Mindset: Open to exploring new technologies; suggests digital or operational enhancements.
Collaboration & Communication: Comfortable working with stakeholders at all levels; excels at concise messaging and presentations.
Adaptability & Continuous Learning: Thrives in a dynamic environment; seeks feedback to grow professionally.
What we offer

A competitive salary
A great working environment & fast-track career trajectory
A healthy work-life balance
Health insurance Benefits
What is it like to work at Infomineo?

If you've spoken with someone who works at Infomineo, you've probably heard that our people are our most valuable asset. Our diversity, both in terms of professional experience and culture, is the company’s greatest strength.

As a Senior Associate in Career Process Optimization & Insights, you’ll be part of a collaborative, international HR team focused on innovation and impact. You'll contribute to initiatives around career development, performance management, and employee engagement, while learning best practices in process optimization and HR analytics. Your ideas will help streamline processes and shape meaningful talent programs, playing a key role in enhancing the employee experience and supporting Infomineo’s growth.

Equal opportunity employer

Infomineo is an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any sort of discrimination (based on color, race, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin or any other attributes) in all aspects of employment (recruiting, hiring, wages and salary, promotions, benefits, trainings and job termination).

If you believe you match our requirements and values, we would be happy to hear from you. Visit our website to know more about us, our services and company culture.

Job Description
About the job Creative Manager (ecommerce)
Do you possess a strong creative vision, a passion for crafting compelling brand narratives, and a proven ability to drive conversions through impactful design? Are you an Amazon expert with a knack for optimizing listings and ad creatives for maximum impact? If you're a data-driven leader ready to elevate a vibrant crafting brand, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Our client, ThreadNanny (https://www.threadnanny.com/), is looking for a talented and results-oriented Creative Manager. In this key role, you will be responsible for leading and directing all creative efforts, ensuring brand consistency, optimizing Amazon visuals for performance, and driving engagement across multiple platforms. Your hands-on expertise in e-commerce creative, coupled with your leadership skills and understanding of the US market, will be crucial in amplifying ThreadNanny's brand presence and achieving ambitious growth targets.

Responsibilities:

Visionary creative leadership: Define and champion a strong creative vision encompassing branding, storytelling, and conversion-focused design across all touchpoints.
Team leadership & development: Lead and mentor a team of graphic designers, providing clear creative briefs, constructive feedback, and fostering a collaborative and high-performing environment.
Competitive landscape analysis: Conduct thorough research on competitor visuals and continuously refine ThreadNanny's creative output based on market trends and best practices.
Conversion-focused optimization: Leverage your deep e-commerce expertise to create and optimize content (Amazon images, infographics, Premium A+, social media ads), ensuring maximum visual appeal, keyword integration, and conversion effectiveness.
AI-powered content innovation: Utilize AI tools to enhance content creation processes, improve design aesthetics, and develop engaging video content.
Influencer & UGC strategy: Develop and manage influencer collaborations and user-generated content (UGC) initiatives to drive brand awareness, engagement, and sales.
Video content creation: Oversee the creation of engaging video content, including writing scripts for ads, UGC integrations, and product demonstrations.
A/B testing & iteration: Implement rigorous A/B testing and utilize polls to continuously improve visual effectiveness and gain insights into what resonates best with the target audience.
Performance-driven optimization: Analyze performance data (CTR, CVR, ROAS, ACOS) to identify areas for creative improvement and implement data-backed optimizations across all visual assets.
Cross-platform brand consistency management: Develop and execute comprehensive content strategies for both Amazon and various social media platforms (Google, TikTok, Meta), ensuring brand consistency and audience engagement.
Product launch creative coordination: Oversee the creation of all creative assets required for product launches, ensuring seamless integration with overall marketing campaigns.
Sales & positioning alignment: Ensure all creative materials effectively communicate product positioning and align with overarching sales goals.
Requirements:

Strong creative vision: Demonstrated ability to develop and articulate a clear and compelling creative vision across branding, storytelling, and conversion-driven design.
Excellent communication skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate creative concepts and provide constructive feedback.
Proven Amazon expertise: Deep understanding of Amazon listing optimization, A+ content best practices, and the creation of high-performing ad creatives.
US market experience: Prior experience working with US-based brands specifically targeting the US market.
Influencer & social media management: Proven experience managing influencer collaborations and leading successful social media marketing campaigns (Tiktok, Meta).
AI-driven content & automation: Experience leveraging AI-driven content creation and automation tools to enhance efficiency and creative output.
Data-driven mindset: Ability to understand and analyze performance metrics (CTR, CVR, ROAS, ACOS) and apply data-driven insights to optimize creative output.
Proven leadership experience: Demonstrated experience in effectively directing and motivating creative teams to achieve project goals.
Portfolio showcase: A strong portfolio demonstrating successful creative work across branding, e-commerce, and digital marketing, with a focus on driving measurable results.
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

High-quality creative output: Consistent delivery of a high volume of impactful and on-brand creative assets (listings, A+ content, ads, video ads, etc.) within established timelines.
Improved Amazon listing conversion rate: Significant increase in Amazon listing conversion rates following creative updates and optimizations.
Growth in external traffic & sales: Measurable increase in external traffic and sales directly attributed to UGC, influencer collaborations, and branded content initiatives.
Enhanced ad creative performance: Improvement in key ad creative metrics such as CTR, ROAS, and ACOS.
If you are a highly creative, data-savvy leader with a passion for e-commerce and a proven ability to drive brand growth, we encourage you to apply and bring your expertise to the ThreadNanny team!

Job Description
n tant que Pricing Senior Lead, vous êtes responsable de la définition, de l’implémentation et de l’optimisation de la stratégie tarifaire de l’entreprise. Vous pilotez les politiques de prix afin de maximiser la rentabilité tout en assurant la compétitivité sur les marchés cibles.

Responsabilités principales
Définir la stratégie de pricing à court, moyen et long terme en lien avec les objectifs business.
Superviser les analyses de données (comportement client, élasticité prix, concurrence, marges).
Coordonner le déploiement des politiques tarifaires à l’échelle nationale et/ou internationale.
Piloter les initiatives de pricing dynamique ou d’optimisation du revenu (revenue management).
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes Finance, Marketing, Sales, Data et IT.
Construire des modèles de tarification avancés basés sur la data science et les insights marché.
Analyser l’impact des campagnes commerciales, promotions, et évolutions tarifaires.
Assurer une veille concurrentielle régulière sur les pratiques de prix du secteur.
Encadrer une équipe (analystes pricing, data analysts, etc.), si applicable.
Profil recherchéFormation
Bac +5 – École de commerce, d’ingénieur ou université avec spécialisation en finance, économie, statistiques ou marketing quantitatif.
Expérience
6 à 10 ans d’expérience en pricing, revenue management, stratégie ou consulting.
Une expérience dans un environnement B2C ou B2B fortement concurrentiel est un plus.
Compétences techniques
Solide maîtrise des outils d’analyse de données (Excel avancé, SQL, Python, Power BI/Tableau).
Connaissances en data science / modélisation statistique (un atout).
Bonne compréhension des logiques de P&L, marges, élasticité, etc.
Compétences comportementales
Esprit analytique et rigueur.
Excellente communication et capacité à influencer des parties prenantes.
Leadership, esprit d'équipe et orientation résultats.
Adaptabilité et agilité dans un environnement en constante évolution.

Job Description
Our team
A core contributing factor to the influence Instiglio has had thus far includes our collaborative, highly skilled and diverse team. We are a team of 100+ people, representing 15+ nationalities, with offices in Colombia, Kenya, Morocco, Mauritius and the USA. Our team of practitioners has extensive development and government experience, including previous roles in international development banks, management consulting, national governments, multilateral agencies, INGOs and academia.  


How you will make an impact 

Associates and Analysts at Instiglio support project teams in guiding stakeholders through difficult, yet important, changes to their operations by translating complex concepts into understandable insights. You will also gain expertise by contributing to the development of RBF instruments while playing a crucial role in execution of projects. Within the team, you will work directly with a team composed of a Project Lead, Project Manager(s), Senior Associates, and fellow Associates and Analysts. You will also get to develop and hone your people management skills by guiding Analysts and Interns working under you to deliver high-quality services.

Tasks may include:

Contributing to the execution of change management plans for clients and stakeholders across sectors, and in the creation of proposals for clients, using clear communication.
Articulating the technical components of RBF in an eloquent and accessible manner in deliverables.
Developing technical components of RBF instruments from scratch by assessing considerations and trade-offs unique to each design.
Conducting literature reviews and synthesis of the findings as well as executing qualitative and quantitative data analysis, including describing and interpreting graphs, analyzing data and applying statistical concepts (e.g. mean, SD, regressions) to draw actionable insights/hypotheses.
Proposing and structuring data analyses and testing hypotheses.
Actively improving our RBF services and our delivery systems.
Analyzing and understanding all the dimensions of RBF including economic and complex technical concepts.
Who you are

We are growing a team of resourceful go-getters that are driven by our mission, curious about the world, and dedicated to a life of learning. An ideal candidate will have:

Experience:
At least 1-3 years' relevant experience in, strategy/management consulting, international development, public policy research or similar fields.
Experience in data analysis and management.
Experience in quantitative and qualitative research.
Experience in performance management and results-based financing (RBF) are an added advantage.
Education
Bachelor's degree (Bac+4) in Social Sciences, Economics, Statistics, Development Studies, Public Policy, Political Science, Business, Engineering or related fields. Master’s degree in a related field is an added advantage.
Language skills:
Exceptional written and oral communication skills in English and French. Professional working proficiency in Arabic would be an added advantage.
skills:
Skills:
Highly analytical with excellent numerical accuracy.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite applications (Excel, Powerpoint and Word) or Google Workspace (Google Drive, Docs, Sheets, Forms, etc.).
Ability to synthesize technical information into simple concepts and analyze information critically.
Ability to work independently.
High organizational skills and attention to detail.
A team player attitude and enthusiasm for relational work with clients.
Passion for international development.
How you can grow with us
Joining Instiglio as an Associate or Analyst will enable you to accelerate your career in international development, consulting and public service, playing a critical role in shaping and delivering impactful projects with leading development actors. Instiglio has a strong feedback culture, with all staff receiving quarterly formal, structured reviews, in addition to real-time feedback. Additionally, a mentorship system and development plans are in place to ensure that staff receive proper support in their professional development.

Working model and benefits
The incumbent will be based in our Rabat office and the opportunity is open to Moroccans or those with a right to work in Morocco. Instiglio has adopted a hybrid working model i.e., a minimum of two (2) days a week at the office for face-to-face connections. Instiglio offers generous benefits, which include personal days, remote work days, travel and health insurance, a company holiday additional to vacation, and parental leave, among others.

How to apply
Submit your application by attaching an English version of your CV and cover letter. In your cover letter answer the following questions: (1) Why are you a good fit for this role? (2) What is your motivation to apply to Instiglio? We will review applications on a rolling-basis. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Instiglio is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to giving everyone a fair go.

job_title: Scientist l, Biologics LCMS Bioanalysis, QTAS
job_description:
Job Description

AbbVie Inc is embracing new paradigms and technologies to develop novel and life-changing therapies across a diverse range of therapeutic areas. The Quantitative, Translational ADME  Sciences (QTAS) department at AbbVie is seeking a highly motivated and energetic bioanalytical scientist to join the biologics bioanalysis, characterization and proteomics (BBCP) group. The main function of this position will be supporting LC-MS (liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry) - based bioanalysis and method development of biologics entities, specifically for multi-specific antibodies and antibody drug conjugates (ADCs) etc. The ideal candidate will be experienced in the 
optimization and implementation of LC-MS-based bioanalytical methods to support pre-clinical in vivo PK and TK studies. The candidate will be responsible for routine sample preparation, method  development, instrument maintenance, data analysis, writing reports, and presenting data at internal and external meetings.

Responsibilities:  

Perform high-throughput quantitative bioanalysis of biologic therapeutics in biofluids and tissues for PK/PD and TK studies.
Optimize and develop bioanalytical methods for quantifying multi-specific antibodies/drug conjugates in biological matrices using LC-MS MRM assays.
Operate and maintain LCMS and automation instruments; handle troubleshooting as needed.
Maintain electronic laboratory notebooks (ELN) and manage study documentation in the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS).
Collaborate with project representatives and bioanalytical scientists with different backgrounds (LCMS and LBA). Present work internally and externally.

Qualifications

Degree in chemistry, pharmacology or other related fields. BS with 5+ years or MS with 2+ years in a pharmaceutical industry setting with a focus on bioanalysis and mass spectrometry.
Motivated with a strong technical background in high-throughput LC-MS assay operations. 
Highly organized and attention to detail.
Direct experience with multi-specific antibodies and ADCs, including bioanalysis in biological matrices and method development for evaluating in vivo stability is a must.
Experience with immune-affinity purification and sample preparation using automation systems (e.g., TECAN, AssayMap Bravo) is required.
Broad knowledge in analytical separation science and hands-on experience with Agilent 
UPLC and SCIEX Triple Quad mass spectrometer is required. Experience with high resolution mass spectrometers (TOF or orbitrap) is a plus.
Proficiency in managing LIMS software for sample, data, and workflow management is preferred.
Strong data analytical skills: familiarity with Skyline, Analyst, and SCIEX OS for data processing is preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong organizational abilities, and the ability to work independently and thrive in a matrix team environment.
Desire to excel in a fast-paced environment, with strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines effectively.

Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: 

The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. 


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. 

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion.  It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html 

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

job_description:
Job Description & Summary

Rejoignez-nous !
La raison d'être de PwC est de renforcer la confiance au sein de la société et d’apporter des solutions aux enjeux stratégiques de ses clients.
PwC développe au Maroc des missions d’audit, d’expertise comptable et de conseil (stratégie, management, transactions, juridique & fiscal) créatrices de valeur pour ses clients, privilégiant des approches sectorielles.
Plus de 325 000 personnes dans 152 pays à travers le réseau PwC partagent idées, expertises et perspectives innovantes au bénéfice de la qualité de service pour leurs clients et partenaires.
Au Maroc, PwC compte plus de 300 collaborateurs.Rejoignez l’équipe Deals et accompagnez les plus grands investisseurs financiers et stratégiques dans la réalisation de leurs acquisitions ou cessions.
Le pôle Deals de PwC, constitué au Maroc d'environ 25 professionnels expérimentés, s’appuie sur un réseau mondial Deals actif dans 70 pays. Cette practice, qui réunit des expertises complémentaires (Transaction Services, Optimisation de financement et accompagnement dans un contexte "distressed", corporate finance, évaluation), nous permet ainsi de garantir la réussite des projets de nos clients.

Notre équipe intervient notamment auprès de nos clients et les accompagne pour répondre aux spécificités de leurs projets de croissance externe (due diligence acheteur), mais également dans le cadre de processus de cession d’une filiale ou d’une participation (due diligence vendeur, assistance vendeur), ou lors de projets de recherche de financement ou de M&A dans un contexte "distressed". Cette équipe vous permettra d’effectuer des missions variées, aussi bien sur des transactions au Maroc, que sur des deals transfrontaliers (en étroite collaboration notamment avec le bureau PwC de Paris).





Ce que vous pouvez attendre :
- Etre exposé (e) à des environnements internationaux et stimulants, et participer à des deals transfrontaliers

- Analyser les performances historiques et futures d’une cible et identifier les zones de risques associées

- Challenger les éléments de valorisation

- Collaborer avec une grande variété d’interlocuteurs : directeurs financiers, fonds d’investissement, avocats, banquiers d’affaires, consultants en stratégie, fiscalistes, etc.

- Accompagner vos clients dans leurs prises de décisions, en tant qu’ interlocuteur autonome sur vos sujets

- Encadrer les analystes plus juniors/ stagiaires pendant vos missions, les évaluer et les conseiller dans leurs évolutions de carrière

- Avoir une carrière stimulante avec des expériences techniques et humaines de qualité

Ce que nous attendons de vous :

· Vous êtes diplômé (e) d’une grande école de commerce ou d’ingénieur

· Vous vous êtes construit une expérience en finance d’entreprise pendant vos stages ou lors d’expériences précédentes (ex. audit, M&A, Private Equity, contrôle de gestion)

· Votre niveau d’anglais est impérativement courant, à l’écrit comme à l’oral

· Vous êtes curieux (se), rigoureux (se) et savez faire preuve d’agilité

· Vous alliez capacités analytiques, techniques, esprit de synthèse et sens business

· Vous avez le goût du travail en équipe et le sens du service client

job_title: EMEA Business Process Analyst My Workspace
job_description:
Job Description:


Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions, a division of the Arrow Electronics Group (16,500 employees spread across 58 countries, turnover + $29 billion), provides IT professionals (service companies, publishers and integrators) with global technological solutions associated with offers of training and services, in 5 main segments: servers, storage and virtualization, networks and security, infrastructure software and Cloud solutions.
As part of its growth,
ARROW BSC is strengthening its teams and is looking for a EMEA Business Process analyst My workspace


What you will be doing at ARROW:


An Arrow BPM is a strategic leader responsible for optimizing an organization’s operations on a dedicated set of assignments. He/she identifies bottlenecks, streamline workflows, and drives growth by translating complex business needs into efficient processes. He/she meticulously examines existing processes to identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement. He/she creates detailed process maps and redesign workflows to enhance performance and achieve desired outcomes. Successfully implementing process changes requires adept leadership. BPM oversees organizational change initiatives, helps to develop communication plans, provide guidance for training, and support the Change management team to address resistance to ensure smooth transitions. He/she establishes key performance indicators (KPIs) and track process metrics to gauge the effectiveness of process improvements. BPM collects and analyzes data to identify trends, measure progress, and make data-driven decisions. PBM works closely with various departments to gather input from stakeholders and defines standardized metrics. This collaboration ensures that process improvements align with overall business goals.
Good mixture between technical & soft skills is required: Process Mapping and Modeling: Proficiency in tools like BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation), Microsoft Visio to visualize and design efficient processes. Data Analysis: Ability to analyze data using tools like Power BI, or Excel to identify trends and measure process performance. Lean and Six Sigma: Knowledge of Lean management and Six Sigma methodologies to reduce waste and improve process efficiency. Configure Price Quote (CPQ) & Salesforce applications knowledge. Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey process changes and collaborate with stakeholders in fluent English. Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to identify issues and develop innovative solutions. Leadership: Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage change initiatives. Organizational Skills: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects and ensure timely completion. Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business environments and requirements. Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with various departments to gather input and ensure process improvements align with business goals.
Full Permanent contract, Social advantage: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance, Very good working atmosphere in a team of passionate collaborators, Work culture where you can make an impact, Working within an international organization, recognized worldwide in its sector

Organizational Skills: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects and ensure timely completion.
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business environments and requirements.
Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with various departments to gather input and ensure process improvements align with business goals.
What is in it for you?

Full Permanent contract,
Social advantage: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance,
Very good working atmosphere in a team of passionate collaborators,
Work culture where you can make an impact,
Working within an international organization, recognized worldwide in its sector

Job Description
GEC recrute une Project Manager IA – CDI ou Freelance

Vous avez une double comptence en gestion de projet et technologies de l’Intelligence Artificielle ? Rejoignez une mission stratgique au sein d’un grand acteur bancaire Casablanca.

Coordonner les quipes Data Science, IT et mtiers

Suivre les budgets, les ressources et les jalons projet

Assurer la gestion des risques, des alertes et des plans de remdiation

Suivre les indicateurs de performance des projets IA

Contribuer la standardisation des mthodologies de gestion de projets IA

Comptences techniques cls : Bonne comprhension des concepts d’IA et de Machine Learning

Outils de gestion de projet (MS Project, Jira, Trello, Confluence, etc.)

Exprience avec des projets en environnement Data / IA

Capacit vulgariser les enjeux techniques auprs des quipes mtier

Exprience solide en gestion de projets tech, idalement IA ou Data

Leadership, pdagogie, agilit et orientation rsultats

Job description


Nos missions portent sur tout ou partie du cycle d’un projet : cadrage, conception, intégration, recette, déploiement et conduite du changement.
Pour accompagner le développement d’Asterigo, nous recrutons un(e) Consultant(e) expérimenté(e) EPM.
Vos responsabilités et missions possibles, selon votre expérience :


Cadrer et concevoir des solutions autour de la Data/Analytics et de la gestion de la performance, sur un périmètre métier transverse (Finance, Supply Chain, RH, Sales) - Extended Planning & Analysis (xP&A) ;
Participer aux différentes phases de projets d’implémentation et d’administration de solutions analytiques (Datahub, ETL, Model Building, Reporting, Data Visualisation) ;
Conseiller et proposer les solutions optimales en fonction des contraintes du client (délai, budget, ergonomie, performance…) ;
Assurer la satisfaction de votre client et être force de proposition pour répondre à ses besoins ;
Piloter des projets, conduire le changement et assurer l’accompagnement des directions métier postdéploiement ;
Encadrer et faire progresser une équipe.
Votre projet professionnel


En rejoignant Asterigo, vous aurez l’opportunité de développer de nouvelles compétences, de travailler sur des missions variées et d’incarner nos valeurs : Excellence, Proximité & Intrapreneuriat.
Vous contribuerez à la révolution de la transformation digitale en participant à mettre la technologie au service de la performance financière et opérationnelle de nos clients.
Vous travaillerez dans une entreprise à taille humaine et conviviale, qui place le bien-être au travail au cœur de ses priorités et offre de nombreux avantages à ses collaborateurs. Une entreprise engagée dans une démarche RSE, désireuse de créer un impact positif sur l’environnement et sur la société.
Preferred experience


Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur, école de commerce ou titulaire d’un Master spécialisé en mathématiques / informatique décisionnelle.
Vous êtes passionné(e) par le monde de la Data, Analytics, Analyse prédictive, Finance, Supply Chain.
Vous justifiez d’une expérience réussie de 3 ans minimum dans le domaine de la finance (contrôle de gestion, audit) et/ou du conseil en informatique.
Vous connaissez une ou plusieurs solutions EPM ou BI (Board, SAP, Power BI, IBM, Excel…) et vous avez déjà une expérience certifiante sur Anaplan.
Vous vous distinguez par votre curiosité intellectuelle, votre esprit analytique ainsi que votre aisance communicationnelle (orale et écrite).
Vous cherchez à vous inscrire dans la durée avec l’ambition d’élargir le champ de vos compétences et de gagner rapidement en responsabilité.
Vous maîtrisez l’anglais.
🚀 Asterigo est un cabinet de conseil créé en 2019 spécialisé dans le pilotage de la performance financière et opérationnelle. Nous sommes la première société de conseil en France spécialisée dans la mise en place des architectures de planification connectée (xP&A).
Nous accompagnons nos clients dans la transformation digitale de leur système d’information, en industrialisant leurs processus métiers, tout en adressant des périmètres transverses (Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing, Sales, RH).
Nous nous appuyons sur nos partenariats avec les technologies leader dans le domaine de l’EPM (Enterprise Performance Management), comme la solution Anaplan.

Job Description
ABOUT UNILEVER

With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.

At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.

<CATEGORY/FUNCTION INTRODUCTION>

< The Logistics Assistant Manager will play a pivotal role in overseeing the transportation, warehousing, registration, and import/export operations within Unilever. This position requires a detail-oriented individual with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently. The successful candidate will collaborate with various departments to ensure seamless logistics operations that align with Unilever’s strategic goals.

>

JOB PURPOSE

Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world.  If you are <include role’s purpose referring to why the role exists> then this role is just for you!

WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE

Transportation Management

Coordinate and oversee all transportation activities, ensuring timely delivery of goods.
Develop and implement efficient routing plans to optimize transportation costs.
Ensure compliance with transportation regulations and safety standards.
Warehousing Operations

Oversee warehousing activities including inventory management, order fulfillment, and storage optimization
Implement best practices for warehousing processes to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
Collaborate with the warehouse team to maintain accurate inventory records and minimize discrepancies.
Ensure compliance with safety regulations & quality standards within the warehouse environment
Import/Export Coordination

Facilitate all import/export activities in compliance with international trade regulations.
Liaise with freight forwarders, customs brokers, and regulatory agencies to resolve any issues related to shipments.
Monitor shipment status and communicate updates to relevant stakeholders.
Registration Management

Ensure proper registration of products as required by local regulations
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of regulatory changes affecting logistics operations.
Collaborate with legal teams to ensure compliance with all applicable laws regarding product registration.
Team Leadership

Assist in managing a team of logistics professionals, providing guidance and support as needed.
Foster a collaborative work environment that encourages continuous improvement and innovation.
Cost & Savings Projects: Identify areas for process improvement and cost optimization within logistics operations.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Experiences & Qualifications

Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree in Logistics /Supply Chain is preferred.
Experience Requirement: 4 to 6 years of experience in logistics or customer service roles is essential.
skills:
Skills

Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities to assess data and make informed decisions regarding logistics processes.
Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills are necessary for effective interaction with stakeholders, including customers, shipping lines, freight forwarders, and internal teams.
Negotiation Skills: Proficiency in negotiation techniques to secure favorable terms with suppliers and partners.
Organizational Skills: Strong organizational capabilities to manage multiple tasks efficiently while maintaining attention to detail.
Leadership

You are energized by delivering fantastic results. You are an example to others – both your results and your resilience. You are constantly on the lookout for better ways to do things, engaging and collaborating with others along the way.
As an individual you are the one responsible for your own wellbeing and delivering high standards of work. You must also focus on the Consumer and what they need. You are humble and have your head up, looking around to interpret evidence and data smartly, spot issues and opportunities to make things better.
Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors
PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results. Has an owner’s mindset, using data and insight to make decisions.
PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Actively builds own wellbeing and resilience.
CONSUMER LOVE: Whatever their role, always looks for better ways to serve consumers. Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
AGILITY: Explores the world around them, continually learning and developing their skills.
Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life! This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

Job Description

GTM Quality Project Specialist (Short Term Contract)


locationsCasablanca, Morocco time typeVollzeit posted onVor 8 Tagen ausgeschrieben time left to applyEnddatum: 10. April 2025 (Noch 4 Tage Zeit für Bewerbung) job requisition idR-64489 ABOUT UNILEVER
With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.
At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.
JOB PURPOSE


The Go to Market (GtM) Quality role mainly works in Morocco and is part of NALI Quality organization. Role is focused on Quality in the Go to Market operations: implementing, executing, improving, ensuring and providing technical quality support to assembling operations, repacking operations, customers, CLTs, promotions, for Quality Management System (QMS) compliance, regulatory compliance, care line support, on-shelf assessments and incident management for Home and Personal care. Moreover, he/she supports Innovations, development of new specifications…
WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE


Lead and support all Go to market operations in the country, in alignment with the Unilever Quality policy and QMS and being the first point of contact for consumer and customers in case of any quality issue in the distribution. Lead and support quality audit programs in the factory, distribution, and market, ensure gaps identification and follow up on CAPA. Lead quality capabilities development programs with distributors, warehousemen, merchandizers and co-packers. Ensure risk management, validation of specifications and agreement of reliable standards / tolerances for all new innovation, with deep involvement in local projects. Continuously communicate and drive quality improvement programs within Morocco, with Factory, Distributors and on shelf to ensure the deploy of the quality procedures for the GTM operations. Supports consumer & customer complaints and requests (communication, actions and monitoring) and setting proper CAPA. Ensures and verifies ongoing compliance to UL Quality management standards in UL & 3rd Party manufacturing sites, warehouses, repackers and Merge & Acquisition (M&A)) through audits, KPI monitoring and non-conformance monitoring, technical visits (as needed), general oversight, supporting technical capability assessments and closure of gaps identified. Including onboarding of new partners. Targeted analysis of quality data and preparation of KPI based performance reports. Identification and transfer of "Best Practices" into the business within the region. Drive Proactively the Quality culture value cross the whole company, engaging people and make them accountable for their own area of responsibility to ensure fully compliance with QMS and policy
Experiences & Qualifications


Hungry to learn and curious. A dot connector: You have the unique ability to think differently and pull the big picture and small details all together clearly Digital Savvy, forward thinker, future obsessed bachelor’s degree.
skills:

Collaboration skills. Quality standards. Audit & investigation Mastery of the Microsoft office package (Excel, Word, PPT…) 0 to 2 years of Quality experience.

job_title: Value and Display Category Manager Africa
job_description:
Job Description
Job Summary
• This role is responsible for product line management and contribution to defining business plans and growth strategies. The role collaborates with sales teams to ensure seamless execution of category plans while monitoring KPIs and sales performance. The role demonstrates a deep understanding of product categories and acts as an expert in providing directions and guidance for process improvements and establishing policies.
Responsibilities

• Leads the partnership engagements with external IT vendors.

job_title: Medical Physics Advisor Application Support (French-Speaker), Morocco (M/F)
job_description:
Job Description

We shape innovation in healthcare. For everyone. Wherever they are.

Siemens Healthineers' portfolio of innovative solutions plays a central role in clinical decision-making and the patient care journey. With a workforce of 71 000 passionate employees in over 70 countries, we push the boundaries of what is possible to help everyone live longer and healthier lives.

Are you looking to join an innovative company and become a part of transforming our healthcare system?

As part of the development of its activities, Varian Business Area is looking for the Medical Physics Advisor Application Support. This position will be based in Casablanca in Morocco.

Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Radiation Oncology Business Area, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.

We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.

Job Summary:

The Medical Physics Advisor Application Support will advise and support the Application Support Team and customers within the assigned area of the latest most advanced medical physics Varian related knowledge to provide customers the highest level of training.Make sure they are confident in operating their Varian equipment in a safe and efficient way and maximize their satisfaction.

Your Tasks and Responsibilities:

Define, in close cooperation with the Zone Manager Applications Support, the business and staffing needs (in the assigned area), to ensure that a safe and optimal medical physics support is provided to our customers with corporate guidelines and EMEIA rules on medical equipment safety
Promote and maintain a high degree of medical physics knowledge among the local Application Support personnel, for them to serve customers in the most effective manner by permanently keeping informed regarding all operating characteristics, design factors, technical performance and developments of Varian’s products
Perform remote and onsite customers trainings of Eclipse, IMRT/RA, SRT/SBRT, Brachytherapy and other/future medical physics related Varian product.
2nd level Support and assistance to Application Support physics and radiographers team on customer trainings.
Can participate in the development of classroom and on-site training concepts and programs for customers and Varian employees, to ensure the most effective courses are delivered to optimize customers’ and employees’ knowledge on Varian’s products
Cooperate with other departments within Varian to identify and address training needs on all current and new Varian physics products
Support Sales & Marketing on medical physics for road shows, sale support and conferences
Coordinate the allocation of Applications Support Physicist for testing of Varian products/prototypes and new applications systems as well as Customer Evaluation Testing activities.
Identify Medical Physics support requirements within the assigned area and cooperate with the zone lead manager and other departments, to ensure Applications Support Physicist are hired, trained, developed, and motivated to meet their current job responsibilities and the company’s future growth plans
Perform other duties as assigned
Minimum Required Skills and Knowledge:

Successfully completed degree in Medical Physics either master or Doctorate degree in medical physics.
Minimum of 10 years professional experience in the radio-oncology field with radiotherapy equipment
Minimum of 5 scientific articles published or conference presentations in an organization of national or international importance.
Thorough understanding of customers of the assigned area and their requirements
Excellent knowledge of training techniques and methodologies to train adults (hospital professionals)
Expert knowledge of processes and methods used in Varian’s product areas.
Expert knowledge of commissioning, QA and planning of IMRT/RA, SBRT/SRT, and Brachytherapy
Minimum of 8 Linacs commissioned: expert knowledge of Commissioning
Expert in Machine & patient QA
Other Requirements:

French, Arabic and English language, written and spoken.
Must be mature and tactful
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Willing to travel extensively
Willing to work normal and non-normal hours as required to support the customers
Ability to train, advice and counsel Applications Support Specialists in technical matters
Ability to adapt and to integrate into, the customer’s technical/operational & safety environment Understanding of customer’s situation and related support needs
Ability to design and deliver trainings and workshop according to Varian standard od excellence
Excellent skills in applying VMS health & safety regulations to job holder’s work environment
GDPR

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open.

Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are strong values that represent our company. We commit to studying all applications in accordance with these values and in full transparency.

Job Description
We are seeking a highly motivated and dynamic Cluster Brand Manager to join Nestlé team. In this role, you will play a vital role in building strong brands that delight target consumers and generate strong business results linked to building brand equity and changing consumer behavior. If you are passionate about building brands, have a track record of driving growth and are a collaborative team player, we would love to hear from you.
Responsibilities:


Develop an in-depth consumer and shopper knowledge through immersions; in-home visits, shopper observations, focus groups to facilitate decision-making by providing ongoing data and insights.
Bring strong digital knowhow to the communication development and media planning process by staying up to date with trends and relevant emerging platforms.
Partner with media and communication agencies and work with our eBusiness teams to expand our brand presence and develop compelling content for digital marketing.
Monitor and analyze brand performance and brand health, identifying gaps, support needed and providing recommendations for improvement.
Support in PFME planning and tracking based on pre-defined budgets, with recommendations to optimize/revise to be submitted to Cluster Marketing Manager/Cluster SBM.
Drive I/R deployment in the cluster for both multi-cluster and cluster specific projects in alignment with the I2L governance and working on the launch plans in collaboration with the cluster/country CDTs.
Own packaging development process for cluster dedicated SKUs following the packaging guidelines and coordinate the process within D2D.
Collaborate with our Cluster Marketing Manager and/or Cluster SBM to develop captivating Annual ICP plans in line with brand/category strategy
Plan and execute promotional activities in line with the overall strategy, coordinating with relevant stakeholders for flawless execution.
Conduct market visits along with CDT to assess competitive landscape, promotional execution, brand activation implementation & identify emerging opportunities and trends in the Cluster.
Actively participate in the monthly review with regional team and clusters for inspiration, learnings, and action plans
Requirements:


4-6 years of experience in marketing, which may include some years in other functions, ideally in CDT/Sales at Nestlé or equivalent FMCG - at least 3 years in Marketing.
Solid Experience in digital marketing is a must.
Strong learning agility, project management with cross functional teams, and communication skills.
Analytical & conceptual ability is a must.

Job Description
Supply Chain Analyst (Production Planner)


At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.


Job Overview


TE Connectivity's Supply Chain Managers are responsible for the timely, cost-effective procurement, inventory control, planning and quality control of production materials. They ensure the availability of materials in the supply chain, as scheduled, and the maintenance of inventory at the established levels. They coordinate and integrate the flow of materials and information among suppliers, manufacturers, distributors and customers, identifying opportunities for improving efficiency, effectiveness and capabilities of the supply chain. Resources are focused on continuous improvement of the movement of materials through production processes, and the establishment of key performance metrics and benchmarks to monitor actual performance against goals.
Your main tasks


• Responsible for Material planning, scheduling and inventory control by using SAP.
• Collaborating with Plants Supply Chain and production teams to address component availability, production-related, and purchasing issues.
• Planning NPI project production in alignment with customer demand and validation requirements.
• Place production orders based on the project needs, if needed, manually adjust the production BOM in accordance with PDS (Product Development Sheet).
• Launch purchase orders and maintain close alignment with suppliers on topics related to material procurement.
• Onboarding new suppliers by managing individual orders and scheduling agreements according to project demands.
• Maintain appropriate material master data in SAP (MRP Views).
• Analyzing potential Supply Chain blockages, focusing on medium- and short-term internal production and supplier capacities.
• Developing Supply Chain mapping for new projects.
• Advises on availability date of finished products to Customer Service teams.
• Highlight BOM / Routing errors when encountered and follow up until resolved with Manufacturing Engineering
• Work with Quality to ensure timely release of finished goods & WIPs, coordinating and scheduling reworks as necessary
Your ideal background


• Master’s degree.
• Minimum 3 years of work experience in Production planning.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Self-organized, structured/methodical, take initiative.
• Strong customer focus.
• Excellent communication skills in English.
• Excellent SAP knowledge required
#LI-ONSITE
Competencies


Values: Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion, Innovation, Teamwork Compensation
• Competitive base salary commensurate with experience: $xxx – xxx (subject to change dependent on physical location)
• Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity.
What TE Connectivity Internship Program offers


TE has a robust internship program that provides our interns with an abundance of resources to feel included as part of our Team. Every summer we coordinate various educational and networking events for our interns. The TE University Relations team will be hosting virtual meetups, information sessions, tours, skill building presentations, and topping it off with National Intern Day celebration activities.
A unique employee resource group we have is the Young Professionals Employee Resource Group (ERG). This group is committed to creating a highly engaged and empowered cross-functional network of young professionals by placing high value in Professional Development, Networking Opportunities and Community Involvement to drive the success of our interns.
In addition to the ERG, we also provide our interns with complete access to our internal library of self-lead courses. These courses include academies like leadership to help the interns develop their development in becoming future leaders at our organization. To help with their professional growth, we provide access to Mentors via our NAVIGATE platform. Mentors serve as a guide to navigate the organization and provide additional support in their career endeavors at the company. Our program provides a holistic experience for interns that targets professional development and personal growth.
Our internship program typically runs May thru August and gives students the opportunity to work on projects that contribute to the success of their team and build on their classroom experience. Throughout the 10–12-week program, interns will be provided with:
• Onboarding & Orientation
• Professional Development Workshops
• Networking Opportunities
• Operations Experience
• Executive Exposure
Timeline


TE Connectivity recruits on campus between September and March for New Grad (FT), Rotational, Internship and Co-op positions beginning in May. Once you have applied to a position, your resume and application will be reviewed. If you are selected to move to the next step in the application process, you will be contacted by a recruiter. Once you accept an offer, the onboarding process will begin in January for interns who have committed to offers in the fall semester and upon acceptance for interns who have committed to offers in the spring semester.
