job_description:
Job Description
At JTI we celebrate differences, and everyone truly belongs. 46,000 people from all over the world are continuously building their unique success story with us. 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI.

To make a difference with us, all you need to do is bring your human best.

What will your story be? Apply now!  

Learn more: jti.com

TOBACCO QUALITY ASSOCIATE

For the new tobacco factory in TETOUAN, we are seeking Quality Associate to monitor production processes, conduct quality inspections, and ensure compliance with safety protocols and JTI standards. This position is based on-site.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Quality Associate, you will be responsible for ensuring the compliance of processes and final products through regular inspections, adhering to the Quality Inspection Plan. You will monitor and check compliance against product specifications, taking necessary corrective actions when requirements are not met.

You will maintain accurate quality inspection data by registering daily test results in the quality database or on hard-copy records as required. This includes calculating daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual averages for test results and preparing and submitting summary reports to your immediate supervisor.

You will inspect material handling and process flows, ensuring all operations follow established procedures. This also includes overseeing brand changeover procedures and demonstrating a strong commitment to health and safety standards.

You will participate in KPI calculations, organize summarized data, and support root cause identification for corrective actions. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing QUIP (Quality Unsure Inspected Products) by holding, segregating, labeling, and inspecting products identified during inspections, as per the established guidelines. You will also help identify the root cause and propose possible solutions for any issues.

You will ensure the proper use and handling of quality measuring instruments (QME), ensuring that equipment is safely utilized and the working area remains clean and organized. Your role will also involve actively participating in system upgrades, ensuring effective implementation, and coaching shop floor operators in adapting to new systems.

Additionally, you will support pest control activities, particularly in managing tobacco beetle, and participate in the implementation of 5S and 3R initiatives to standardize quality laboratories.

EDUCATION

University degree in Chemistry or similar.

WORK EXPERIENCE

2-3 years of work experience in a Manufacturing environment.
skills:
SKILLS

Proficiency in English, French, and Arabic (written and verbal communication)
Strong computer skills with advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite
In-depth knowledge of internal regulatory compliance and procedures
Expertise in safety protocols and maintaining a safe work environment
Solid laboratory skills with experience in quality control processes
Strong understanding of statistical analysis and data interpretation principles
Are you ready to join us? Build your success story at JTI. Apply now!

Next Steps:

After applying, if selected, please anticipate the following within 1-3 weeks of the job posting closure: Phone screening with Talent Advisor > Assessment tests > Interviews > Offer. Each step is eliminatory and may vary by role type.

At JTI, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you need any specific support, alternative formats, or have other access requirements, please let us know.

job_description:
Job Description
Did you know KONE moves over one billion people every day? We employ over 57,000 driven professionals in over 60 countries worldwide, joined together by a shared vision. As a global leader in the elevator and escalator industry, our mission is to improve the flow of urban life.

At KONE, we’re shaping the future of urban living as a global elevator and escalator industry leader committed to delivering innovative solutions and exceptional customer experiences. As a Customer Operations Administrator, you’ll be the voice of KONE, providing critical administrative support in specialized domains such as Operations, Sales Support, Public Tender Preparation, Third Party Inspection, and Reporting. Your role will empower our salespersons and supervisors to maximize their time with customers in the field while ensuring seamless operations behind the scenes. The position will be based in Casablanca, Morocco.

In this dynamic position, you’ll directly support customers by addressing complex queries escalated from Customer Service Agents or other departments, ensuring responsiveness while upholding our high standards for quality and SLA compliance. Collaborating closely with salespersons, supervisors, field technicians, the KONE Customer Service Organization, and KONE Shared Services, you’ll play a pivotal role in driving customer satisfaction and operational excellence. If you’re detail-oriented, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are passionate about making a difference, join us at KONE!

What you will do:

Service Sales Support

Prepare and distribute customer correspondence, including letters and updates to maintenance contracts.
Process maintenance contract terminations, coordinating with the Billing Administrator for invoice cancellations or credit note issuance.
Assist in drafting new maintenance contracts for NEB, competitive bids, or renegotiations.
Support VB Sales activities by preparing documentation, performing quality checks, and assembling internal handover packs.
Conduct data validation and quality audits for new contracts received from the KONE Shared Service Center.
New Building Sales Support

Assist in preparing tenders and finalizing orders for submission to order administration.
Manage the preparation and archiving of customer documentation and correspondence.
Conduct customer credit checks during tendering and ordering processes.
Own escalated customer inquiries, collaborating with sales teams and other services to ensure prompt responses.
Support the maintenance and updating of customer data.
Specialized Administration and Support Tasks:

Analyze inspection requirements and schedule individual inspections.
Assist sales teams in creating proposals for public tenders.
Verify and input customer data into customer portals (primarily managed by KONE SSC).
Generate reports for Key Accounts.
Are you the one?

Education: Higher vocational diploma in technical or commercial sciences.
Office Tools Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint); advanced skills are a plus.
Communication: Good spoken and written local language skills, with experience in office and customer communication.
Financial & Contract Knowledge: Basic understanding of contracts and finances; deeper knowledge is preferred.
Technical Skills (Optional): Ability to understand basic technical concepts is a bonus.
SAP/SFDC Experience (Optional): Familiarity with SAP or Salesforce is an advantage.
Relevant Experience (Optional): Prior experience in a similar role is helpful but not required.
What do we offer?

Great dynamic team promoting a collaborative environment.
Total reward elements that engage and motivate our employees and help us make KONE a great place to work.
Comprehensive learning and development programs covering a wide range of professional skills.
Engaging job with position description and clear targets.
Regular feedback through performance discussions.
Opportunities for individual development.
An ethical business environment.
Mentoring and coaching programs.
Flexibility, trust and respect.
Value-based culture, behaviors and ethics.
Sustainability and innovation.
Working for a successful organization.
Applicants must upload their updated CV in English when applying for the position for us to review their details.

At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life.

Read more on www.kone.com/careers

Job Description
Our client, a growing consultancy, is looking for a HubSpot Specialist to take ownership of all things HubSpot. This role is ideal for someone highly proficient in HubSpot CRM, automation, reporting, and campaign execution who thrives in a fast-paced, detail-oriented environment. You will be the go-to person for building workflows, managing integrations, and optimizing HubSpot functionalities to drive efficiency and success.

Location: Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Key Responsibilities

HubSpot Management – Oversee and maintain all aspects of HubSpot, ensuring optimal performance and alignment with business needs.

Hands-On Project Coordination – Execute projects such as building reports, creating landing pages from templates, and optimizing existing HubSpot components.

Workflow Automation – Develop and maintain HubSpot workflows and automation processes to enhance efficiency and improve user experience.

Email Marketing & Sequences – Design and implement email sequences, campaign automations, and drip marketing to improve engagement and conversions.

CRM Data Management – Ensure data cleanliness, segmentation, and accuracy within HubSpot.

Collaboration with Developers & Stakeholders – Work closely with the development team and key business stakeholders to improve integration between HubSpot and other platforms.

Technical Support & Troubleshooting – Identify, diagnose, and resolve HubSpot-related issues while implementing best practices.

Integration & Connectivity – Work with Google Workspace and Office 365 to ensure seamless connectivity across tools.

What Success Looks Like

Fully optimized HubSpot environment with streamlined workflows and automation.

Accurate and insightful reporting to inform strategic decisions.

Seamless execution of campaigns using email sequences, landing pages, and CRM segmentation.

Cross-team collaboration that enhances efficiency between marketing, sales, and development teams.

Proactive identification and resolution of HubSpot-related challenges.

Qualifications

Experience

3+ years of experience managing HubSpot CRM, workflows, and automation.

HubSpot Proficiency

Deep expertise in HubSpot Sales, Marketing, and Service Hubs, including workflows, reporting, email marketing, and CRM optimization.

CRM & Data Management

Strong understanding of data segmentation, lead nurturing, and reporting.

Technical Aptitude

Familiarity with Google Workspace and Office 365; experience integrating HubSpot with third-party tools is highly desirable.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent written and verbal English skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally with teams.

Detail-Oriented & Organized

Strong project coordination and task management skills.

Opportunity
This is an exciting opportunity to own the HubSpot function within a growing consultancy. You will have the chance to streamline automation, enhance reporting, and optimize workflows, working alongside a collaborative and forward-thinking team. If you're looking to make an impact and leverage your HubSpot expertise in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply!

Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form

Record a video showcasing your skill sets

Job Description
About the job Shopify Growth Manager/ CRO Expert
Are you a Shopify expert with a proven track record of scaling e-commerce brands? Do you thrive on data-driven growth strategies, conversion optimization, and performance marketing? If so, this brand is looking for you!

About the brand
Founded in 2014, we are a leading hijab brand revolutionizing how Muslim women in the West shop for modest fashion - https://voilechic.com/. Our mission is to empower women through accessibility, quality, and a faith-centered approach. Were now seeking a highly skilled CRO Expert to take our brand to the next level!

Role Overview
As our Shopify Growth Manager, you will be responsible for optimizing our Shopify store, improving the customer journey, and driving revenue growth. You will implement data-driven strategies to increase conversion rates, boost order value, and maximize repeat purchases.

Key Expectations within 6 Months:
- Increase conversion rate by at least 25%
- Grow average order value (AOV) by at least 20%

Key Responsibilities

Shopify Optimization Enhance user experience, user journey and optimize website to maximize sales.
A/B Testing & CRO Implement split tests on landing pages, checkout flow, and product pages to drive conversions.
Sales Funnel Strategy Develop and execute strategies to increase order frequency, reduce cart abandonment, and improve upselling tactics.
Data Analysis Use tools like Google Analytics, Shopify Reports, Hotjar, and heatmaps to track KPIs and identify optimization opportunities.
Marketing Collaboration Work closely with our marketing team to align store strategies with paid ads, email marketing, and retention campaigns.
Must-Have Skills
- 5+ years of experience in e-commerce operations
- Expert-level Shopify knowledge (themes, apps, integrations)
- Strong English communication skills (written & verbal)
- Proven success in CRO, A/B testing, and increasing key metrics
- Ability to analyze and act on customer data to drive growth
Nice-to-Have Skills (Bonus Points!)
Familiarity with paid ads, SEO, or retention marketing
Experience with TikTok Shop and emerging e-commerce platforms
Knowledge of email automation tools like Klaviyo

What We Offer
- Remote position (Work 9 AM - 5 PM EST with flexibility)
- Competitive salary including performance bonuses
- Opportunity for salary growth and career advancement based on performance
- Be part of a mission-driven brand making an impact worldwide
How to Apply
If you're ready to drive growth and scale a thriving Shopify brand, apply today! Send your resume, and a short video explaining why you would be a good fit. You can include examples of past experience and results.

Working with our channel partners, we optimize the efficiency with which organizations can store, manage, protect and deploy their data, equipping them with secure access to business-critical information at any time, from any location, on any device.
Through close alliances with the world’s leading vendors, we deliver innovative solutions, complemented by an impressive portfolio of expert professional services and IT training. We support our channel partners from initial consultation, planning and design, engineering build through to implementation and post-sales care.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR:


Previous experience of working in a business service sector (Purchasing Department) will be advantageous, Excellent written italian skills, Honest, hardworking, self motivated, reliable and diligent, Fully accountable and take ownership to resolution, Excellent administration skills, Excellent communication skills, with the ability to liaise with both internal and external contacts at all levels, Able to work as part of a team or on their own initiative, Ability to pay close attention to detail, Able to work towards tight deadlines, Good knowledge of Microsoft packages – Excel, Word, Microsoft Outlook .

Job Description
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride. 

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone. 

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together. 

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries. 

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

🌟 Lead & Inspire:

Manage and motivate a team of 10 Account Managers. Be their mentor, guide, and biggest supporter.
Create a positive, collaborative atmosphere where innovation, creativity, and continuous growth thrive.
🤝 Partner Management:

Ensure your team builds strong, lasting relationships with Glovo’s partners through regular, proactive communication.
Understand partner needs, keep them engaged, and work on strategies to boost satisfaction and loyalty.
Work hand-in-hand with your team to deliver tailored solutions that help each partner grow and succeed.
📊 Data-Driven Decisions:

Use data and insights to guide strategies that improve partner operations.
Develop actionable plans based on performance data, ensuring decisions are informed and impactful.
📈 Performance & Process Optimization:

Keep an eye on key metrics (KPIs) and use dashboards to track partner performance.
Identify areas for improvement and implement solutions that make a difference.
Review and refine processes to make partner management smoother and more efficient.
🤗 Collaborative Growth:

Learn from your team and share your knowledge. We believe in growing together in a supportive, empowering environment.
WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE RIDE

✅ Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or Sales.
5+ years of experience in key account management or leadership roles with high-performing teams.
🗣️ Skills:

Excellent communicator in both French and English.
Strong commercial acumen with a problem-solving, data-driven mindset.
Organized, detail-oriented, and skilled in project management.
Empathetic, curious, and an inclusive team player.
💻 Tech & Industry Knowledge:

Proficient with productivity tools like Office 365 and Salesforce.
Experience in fast-growing digital startups is a plus!
Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We believe driven talent deserves:

💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.
Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard. 

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Job Description:


Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions (ECS), a part of Arrow Electronics, brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners. We help businesses grow faster, operate efficiently and transform in a dynamic market.
Position Summary:


The System Administrator with Access Management Specialization plays a critical role in managing and maintaining the organization's IT infrastructure while ensuring secure and efficient user access to systems, applications, and data. This role is focused on access management processes, identity lifecycle management, and maintaining compliance with security policies.
Key Responsibilities:


System Administration:
1. Infrastructure Management:
o Maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot servers, storage, and cloud environments (on-premises or cloud-based).
o Perform software and hardware updates for systems, ensuring optimal functionality and security.
o Monitor system health and performance, and ensure high availability and reliability.
2. Security and Compliance:
o Implement security policies and protocols across systems.
o Conduct regular system audits and reviews to ensure compliance with regulatory and organizational standards.
3. Backup and Recovery:
o Develop and maintain backup strategies for critical data and systems.
o Execute disaster recovery plans and troubleshoot system failures as needed.
Access Management:


1. Identity and Access Lifecycle:
o Manage user accounts, roles, and permissions for systems, applications, and databases.
o Onboard/offboard users in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.
o Facilitate provisioning and de-provisioning of system access.
2. Authentication and Authorization:
o Configure and maintain Single Sign-On (SSO), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and role-based access controls (RBAC).
o Ensure secure access for internal and external users while minimizing risks.
3. Access Policies:
o Design and implement policies for access control (e.g., least privilege principles).
o Regularly review and update access policies to align with evolving security requirements.
Incident Management:


1. Investigate and respond to access-related security incidents.
2. Resolve access issues promptly, minimizing disruption to users.
Collaboration and Support:


1. Work closely with IT teams, security teams, and business stakeholders to address access requirements and optimize workflows.
2. Provide end-user support for authentication and access-related issues.
3. Deliver training and documentation for users on access protocols and systems.
Requirements:


Education

:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Experience:


• Proven experience in system administration roles.
• Strong expertise in access management technologies (e.g., Active Directory, Azure AD, IAM systems).
skills:
Skills:


1. Technical Skills:
Proficiency in server operating systems (e.g., Windows Server, Linux).
Knowledge of authentication protocols (e.g., LDAP, Kerberos, OAuth).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
2. Analytical and Problem-Solving:
o Ability to diagnose and resolve access-related issues quickly and efficiently.
o Capability to analyze access data and identify potential risks.
3. Communication:
o Effective verbal and written communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
4. Organizational Skills:
o Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
o Familiarity with access management workflows and ticketing systems.
#LI-JC1 #LI-HYBRID

job_title: Graphic Design - Graphic Designer PPT Expert - Casablanca
job_description:
Job Description
About us

Infomineo is a fast-growing business insights provider, bringing Brainshoring to global clients across a range of services: Business research, Content Services, Graphic Design, and Data Analytics. Our clients include leading Consultancies, Fortune 500 companies, Governments, and NGOs. Infomineo counts 350+ employees spread across 5 offices covering EMEA and the Americas (Casablanca, Cairo, Dubai, Barcelona and Mexico City). 

About This Role

We are seeking a talented Graphic Designer to join our team, specializing in PowerPoint Consulting Presentations. You will play a key role in creating visually engaging presentations, newsletters, brochures, social media posts, and reports for a wide range of clients in a fast-paced environment.

What will you do:

Design High-Impact PowerPoint Presentations: Create visually compelling and structured consulting presentations that align with brand guidelines and effectively communicate key messages.
Develop Engaging Visual Content: Design newsletters, brochures, reports, and social media graphics that enhance brand identity and storytelling.
Enhance and Optimize Existing Materials: Improve the quality and consistency of client-facing and internal materials by refining layouts, typography, colors, and data visualization.
Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with consultants, project managers, and marketing teams to understand requirements and deliver tailored design solutions.
Ensure Brand Consistency: Uphold design standards and brand guidelines across all deliverables, maintaining a high level of quality and professionalism.
Manage Multiple Projects: Prioritize tasks effectively, handle tight deadlines, and adapt to shifting project needs while maintaining attention to detail.
Stay Up-to-Date with Design Trends & Tools: Continuously improve design approaches by exploring new trends, tools, and best practices in PowerPoint and graphic design.
You’re Good at:

PowerPoint Mastery: Crafting visually compelling, structured, and on-brand PowerPoint presentations with a strong understanding of slide design, templates, and data visualization.
Design Thinking: Applying layout, typography, color theory, and branding principles to create cohesive and engaging visual content.
Visual Storytelling: Transforming complex information into clear, digestible, and aesthetically appealing designs that enhance communication.
Attention to Detail: Ensuring consistency in formatting, alignment, and overall design quality across all deliverables.
Time & Project Management: Handling multiple projects efficiently, meeting deadlines, and adapting to shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaboration & Communication: Working closely with stakeholders, understanding project requirements, and translating ideas into polished visuals while maintaining brand integrity.
Technical Proficiency: Utilizing design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) alongside PowerPoint to produce high-quality work across various formats.
Your Experience, Education & Qualification

Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or a related field.
3+ years of experience in graphic design, with a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in PowerPoint presentations and print/digital collateral.
Proficiency in design software, especially PowerPoint, Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), any additional software expertise is a plus.
Strong attention to detail, creativity, and problem-solving skills.
What we offer:

A competitive base salary
Healthcare benefits
A great company culture
High potential for career advancement in a fast-growing company
What is it like to work at Infomineo?

If you've spoken with someone who works at Infomineo, you've probably heard that our people are our most valuable asset. Our diverse team—across both professional experience and culture—is the company’s greatest strength.

By joining Infomineo as a Graphic Designer, you'll be part of a creative, innovative, and global team that values visual storytelling and impactful design. You'll have the opportunity to transform complex information into clear, compelling, and visually engaging presentations that resonate with top-tier clients across industries and regions. Your expertise in PowerPoint design, layout, and branding will play a key role in enhancing business communication and strategic decision-making. Beyond presentations, you'll collaborate on a variety of design projects, refining your creative and technical skills while contributing to the company’s visual identity. As a key team member, your work will help shape how we present ideas, data, and insights to international institutions and leading companies.

Equal opportunity employer

Infomineo is an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any sort of discrimination (based on color, race, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, or any other attributes) in all aspects of employment (recruiting, hiring, wages and salary, promotions, benefits, trainings and job termination).

If you believe you match our requirements and values, we would be happy to hear from you. Visit our website to know more about us, our services and company culture.

Job Description
Health Economics Senior Consultant (Real-World Evidence) page is loaded
Health Economics Senior Consultant (Real-World Evidence)


locationsCasablanca, Morocco time typeFull time posted onPosted Today job requisition idR1444265 We are looking for driven candidates seeking to launch their career in Health Economics and join our regional team based in Casablanca, Morocco to help our clients improve their clinical, scientific and commercial results. You will work in a dynamic, global company of over 60,000 employees in more than 100 countries with a broad range of healthcare information, technology and service offerings.
Our clients operate in the life sciences industry, including the global top 20 pharmaceutical, medical device and biotech companies, as well as public health providers and regulatory authorities. They are looking for insight and evidence around the safety, efficacy, effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of health care delivery systems, medical devices, and pharmaceutical products spanning the full spectrum of therapeutic and disease areas. Our diverse mix of clients, the breadth of disease areas, as well as increasing access to novel data sources and methodologies provide a constant and rewarding challenge for our people.
For more information about our company please visit our website: https://www.iqvia.com/
Role purpose


You will work from our office in Casablanca and report into the Principal Real-World Services, with focus mainly on the Moroccan market and other markets in East, West and North Africa, supporting our regional Real World Services team based in Casablanca, Morocco. Typical projects include development and adaptation of medico-economic models, network meta-analyses, survival analysis and real-world evidence studies using electronic medical records, databases, registries and claims. The audience for these analyses will be various pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical technology companies. As part of a broader team, you will contribute to the design of these type of studies, preparation of the data, analysis, quality control, interpretation and presentation of the results. Part of your role will be to develop proposals and provide clients with high quality and timely solutions to meet their needs.
Principal Accountabilities


1- Business development:
Lead the business development activities and build strong relationships with external stakeholders, including experts, clients, MoH, private and public institutions… Interact with internal and external stakeholders to identify Real world services projects. Assist with client management and attend external meetings.
2- Projects delivery:


Lead the development and adaptation of medico-economic models (cost-effectiveness, cost-utility and budget impact models), Organize and conduct high quality primary and secondary research studies Conduct evidence synthesis by means of meta-analysis, indirect treatment comparison or network meta-analysis (frequentist or Bayesian) with patient-level and/or aggregate data (e.g. from literature review) from RCTs Contribute to the development of value dossiers and support material for clients Conduct retrospective and prospective observational studies, including the development of study protocol, questionnaire, data analysis, study report and publications. Specify and/or extract data from databases; prepare and analyse datasets according to study protocol and SAP Lead the dissemination of any relevant findings through technical reports, manuscripts, posters and presentations, Assist with project management and project delivery, including oral presentations
Qualifications And Skills


MSc or PhD or equivalent in health economics, epidemiology, statistics, biostatistics or related discipline Prior relevant experience working, at least 8 years, as a pharmaco-economist, HEOR and/or Market Access in consultancy, CRO or pharmaceutical/biotech Ability to develop and adapt pharmaco-economics models (e.g. Markov models) Good understanding of the Moroccan healthcare system is a prerequisite Strong numeracy and quantitative skills as well as competency using MS Excel (competency using Visual Basic is a plus) Fluency in French and English (spoken and written) Strong written and verbal communication skills Flexible & problem-solving mindset, excellent attention to detail and ability to check own work so that drafts are delivered to a high quality Strong time-management and organizational skills Attitude to work well as a member of team and to build and manage relationships in a multi-cultural environment Eligibility to work in Morocco without visa sponsorship
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com
IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide . Learn more at
IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create connections that accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments. Everything we do is part of a journey to improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide.
To get there, we seek out diverse talent with curious minds and a relentless commitment to innovation and impact. No matter your role, everyone at IQVIA contributes to our shared goal of helping customers improve the lives of patients everywhere. Thank you for your interest in growing your career with us.

Job Description
Role Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative Senior Architect to join our client dynamic team. This role offers a unique opportunity to collaborate within an international, multi-paradigm team, working on a diverse range of projects involving cutting-edge technologies such as high-performance computing, Big Data analytics, Machine Learning, 5G, and the digital transformation of governments and businesses.

This position is based in Abu Dhabi, UAE.

KEY ACTIVITIES

Technical Strategy & Roadmap Development:

Proactively participate in setting-up the technical strategy and release roadmap for the company
Proactively engage in planning and executing investments in product development and release.
Client Consultation & Technical Discussions:

Conduct comprehensive technical discussions with clients regarding project intricacies.
Technology Assessment & Implementation:

Evaluate disruptive and competitive technologies.
Design and implement sophisticated systems requiring high performance and scalability. 
Establishment and upkeep of software engineering processes and best practices.
Daily communication of technical matters with clients, partners, and third-party providers.
Leadership & Team Management:

Adhere to company values in conduct.
Lead multiple development teams in the design and development process.
Provide technical leadership throughout project lifecycles: Architectural design, resource allocation, delegation, progress oversight, deployment coordination.
Identify and address problem areas while mentoring team members on technological aspects.
Engage with peers and partners on technical matters and mentor team members on technological aspects.
Resolve technical disputes and making decisions regarding the tech stack.
Continuous Learning & Integration:

Stay updated with the latest technology advancements and best practices in high- performance computing, networking, and related fields.
Incorporate new technologies and practices into the team's development process as applicable.
Troubleshooting & Quality Assurance:

Identify and resolve technical issues related to performance and scalability.
Participate in code reviews to ensure high-quality code adhering to established standards. 
Manage escalated developments and issues in the ticketing system and intervene to clarify any uncertainties.
skills:
Required Skills & Experience

Education:

Bachelor's, Master's, or technical degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems, or a related field. Other degrees will also be considered.
Recent (*) & Substantial (**) Experience in:

Strategic planning and leadership of IT projects and transformations. 
Leading specialized teams and fostering their development.
Steering committees, working groups with senior management, and formulating organizational policies and strategies.
Providing strategic advice to senior management on intricate IT-related matters. 
Negotiating, collaborating, and managing partnerships with departments, agencies, and service providers.
Practical experience in implementing and maintaining industry standards concerning IP network protocols, Cybersecurity, Quality of Service (QoS), and data transmission standards (e.g., ISO 27001, 3GPP, NIST) is essential.
(*) Recent experience denotes experience acquired within the last five (5) years.

(**) Substantial experience implies five (5) or more years performing these roles

Technical Skills:

Passion for technology
Proficiency in the following tech stack:
C, Java 8/18, Python, TypeScript, JavaScript
ElasticSearch, Apache Cassandra, Redis/KeyDB, Apache Druid, SPARK
Spring Framework, gRPC, Protocol Buffers, React, Node.js
Docker, MLOPS tools
Multi-threading and high-performance computing
CentOS, Ubuntu
GitLab, Jira, Confluence
Typical ML libraries like scikit learn, TensorFlow, etc.
Soft Skills:

Proficient in communication: both verbal and written. 
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Effective decision-making skills. 
Leadership and issue resolution expertise. 
Proficiency in team and time management. 
Proficiency in coaching and training

job_title: Consultant Réseaux et Sécurité en Freelance Ref. 005962
job_description:
Description du poste

Notre client, un acteur majeur du secteur assurance, recherche un Consultant Réseaux et Sécurité pour une mission Freelance. Ce rôle clé vise à sécuriser les infrastructures IT, garantir la conformité aux normes sectorielles et accompagner la transformation digitale de l’entreprise.

Mission

En tant qu’expert Réseaux et Sécurité, vous serez responsable de :

Concevoir et sécuriser les architectures réseau :
Auditer et optimiser les infrastructures existantes (LAN, WAN, VPN, cloud hybride).
Déployer des solutions de sécurité (firewalls, IDS/IPS, NAC, Zero Trust) adaptées aux besoins métiers.
Protéger les données sensibles (clients, contrats) via des mécanismes de chiffrement, DLP et IAM.
Garantir la conformité réglementaire :
Appliquer les normes sectorielles (RGPD, Solvabilité II) et frameworks de sécurité (ISO 27001, NIST).
Préparer et accompagner les audits de sécurité internes/externes.
Gérer les incidents et la continuité d’activité :
Mettre en place des plans de réponse aux incidents (PRA/PCA) et des protocoles de résilience.
Analyser les vulnérabilités et proposer des correctifs prioritaires.
Collaborer avec les équipes IT et métiers :
Former les équipes internes aux bonnes pratiques de cybersécurité.
Piloter des projets transverses (migration cloud, modernisation des data centers).
Profil recherché

Formation & Expérience

Diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur (spécialisation réseaux/cybersécurité) ou Master en sécurité informatique.
5 ans d’expérience minimum en conception et sécurisation d’infrastructures réseaux, idéalement dans le secteur assurance, banque ou financier.
Expérience avérée en régie ou conseil auprès de grands comptes.
Compétences techniques

Expertise réseaux :
Protocoles (TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF), virtualisation (SD-WAN, NSX), et outils de monitoring (SolarWinds, Wireshark).
Sécurité : Pare-feux (Palo Alto, Fortinet), solutions de détection d’intrusions (Cisco Firepower), et gestion des identités (Okta, Azure AD).
Cloud : Sécurisation d’environnements hybrides (AWS, Azure) et architectures Zero Trust.
Conformité :
Maîtrise des réglementations sectorielles (RGPD, Solvabilité II, DORA) et normes de sécurité.
Certifications (CISSP, CISM, CEH) un atout.
Soft Skills

Analytique : Capacité à identifier les risques et prioriser les actions.
Pédagogie : Aptitude à vulgariser des enjeux techniques pour des publics non-experts.
Réactivité : Gestion efficace des crises et incidents critiques.
Collaboration : Expérience en travail transversal avec des équipes DevOps, Data et métiers.
--

job_description:
Job Description
Nous recherchons pour l’un de nos clients un Chef de projet Technique Salesforce Marketing Cloud en Freelance.

Localisation : Rabat / Casa
Présence sur site : Minimum 2 jours / semaine
Disponibilité : ASAP
MISSION

Assurer l’ensemble des développements liés aux Custom Activities (Front, Back, RestAPI, etc) Marketing Cloud Engagement.
Paramétrer techniquement l’outil Salesforce Marketing Cloud Engagement (Data Extensions, Automations, Journey Builder etc). En effet, une forte appétence technique sur MCE est attendue.
Apporter le support (Optimisation, Débogage, Faisabilité, Gestion des Réclamations, etc) nécessaire au métier dans leur utilisation quotidienne de la plateforme.

Job Description
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

Babel est une multinationale espagnole qui compte à peu près de 3000 employés dans le monde présente déjà dans 4 continents qui offre des services en technologies nouvelles visant à accompagner les grandes organisations dans leur processus de transformation digitale.

Quel est notre plan stratégique ?

Nous regardons vers l'avenir ! Notre plan stratégique Hyperspace 2029 promet d'être un voyage passionnant, plein d'opportunités de croissance et de développement professionnel. Atteindre un chiffre d'affaires de 1 milliard d'euros, un défi que nous sommes sûrs de relever grâce à la collaboration et au talent de notre équipe, sera une autre histoire de succès que nous écrirons ensemble.

Quel profil nous recherchons?

Nous recherchons un Développeur Mobile Android maîtrisant React Native et Eclipse pour concevoir, développer et maintenir des applications mobiles performantes et sécurisées. Vous travaillerez en collaboration avec les équipes produit, design et backend pour offrir des solutions innovantes et fluides aux utilisateurs.

Missions principales

    Développement et maintenance d’applications Android

Concevoir et développer des applications mobiles sous Android en utilisant React Native et Eclipse.
Assurer l’intégration avec les API et les bases de données.
Garantir la compatibilité des applications avec différentes versions d’Android et différents appareils.
Améliorer les performances, la rapidité et la fluidité des applications.
Corriger les bugs et assurer la maintenance évolutive des applications.
Mettre en place des tests unitaires et fonctionnels pour garantir la stabilité du code.
Optimiser les parcours utilisateurs pour une expérience fluide et agréable.

📌 Sécurité et conformité

Implémenter des solutions de sécurité avancées (authentification, chiffrement des données, protection contre les cyberattaques).
Assurer la conformité avec les normes et réglementations en vigueur.
Langages : Java/Kotlin, React Native.
Environnement : Eclipse, Android Studio.
Frameworks & outils : Redux, REST API, Firebase.
Méthodologies : Agile, CI/CD, Git.
Que proposons-nous ?

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.


Veux-tu faire partie d'une équipe en expansion, engagée et innovante qui fait l'histoire chaque jour ?  Chez Babel, nous t'accompagnons sur le chemin du succès.  Nous croyons au talent des personnes et nous voulons le valoriser en vous offrant un excellent environnement de travail basé sur la collaboration et la solidarité.
Travailler chez Babel, c'est bien plus que travailler dans une entreprise, c'est rejoindre une équipe de personnes avec une mission partagée et un modèle d'entreprise axé sur les valeurs.
De plus,

Nous investissons dans la formation de nos Babelievers.
Nous investissons dans ta santé physique et émotionnelle.  (Assurance Maladie Privée / Assurance Vie, Plan de retraite).
Nous investissons également dans ton temps libre (Team building, Happy Day, AfterWork, Team Day.. )
Nous participons à la croissance de l'entreprise et reconnaissons la contribution de chaque personne (Prime de Bénéfices).
Nous mettons l'accent sur le travail avec les dernières technologies et les projets innovants, mais surtout, nous accompagnons la transformation numérique et rapprochons la technologie de la société.
Acceptes-tu le défi ? Nous t'attendons !

Chez Babel, nous favorisons un environnement de travail basé sur le respect de nos professionnels, le développement professionnel et la promotion de l'égalité des chances sans aucune discrimination.

Conformément à la législation en vigueur en matière de protection des données, nous vous informons que le GRUPO BABEL est responsable de vos données personnelles (voir les entreprises dans la politique de confidentialité), et qu'il les utilisera pour gérer vos processus de sélection, actuels et futurs, ainsi que pour les autres finalités décrites sur le site web. Ce traitement est basé sur le consentement du candidat. Les données personnelles collectées ne seront en aucun cas transférées à des tiers, sauf en cas d'obligations légales expresses. Vous pouvez exercer vos droits en matière de protection des données à l'adresse suivante : data.protection@babelgroup.com. Toutes les informations sur la politique de confidentialité sont disponibles sur notre site web.

job_title: PMO Senior Infrastructure IT - Secteur Bancaire en Freelance Ref. 005954
job_description:
Job Description
Pour le compte de l'un de nos client, nous recherchons un PMO responsable de la mise en place et du suivi des processus de gestion de projets, en collaboration étroite avec les chefs de projet infra, les responsables de domaines et les parties prenantes.

Durée: 6 mois renouvelable 
Démarrage; ASAP
Localisation: Casablanca, Maroc
MISSION:

1. Soutien aux chefs de projet et responsables de domaines :

Accompagner les chefs de projet (CP) dans la planification, l'exécution et le suivi des projets infrastructure.
Aider les CP à élaborer des plans de projet réalistes, en tenant compte des contraintes techniques, budgétaires et des plannings.
Mettre en place un capacity planning pour mieux distribuer la charge de travail en adéquation avec les capacités des équipes.
Faciliter la communication entre les équipes techniques, les CP et les parties prenantes.
2. Accompagnement sur les outils et le reporting :

Accompagner les sachants et les CP dans l'utilisation des outils de gestion de projets et de reporting.
Mettre en place et maintenir des tableaux de bord (dashboards) pour visualiser l'état des projets et du portefeuille.
Assurer la formation et le support sur les outils de suivi.
Consolider les données et produire des rapports réguliers pour les comités de pilotage et le directoire.
3. Gestion des relations avec les différents services :

Collaborer avec le contrôle de gestion pour assurer le suivi budgétaire et financier des projets.
Travailler avec les achats pour gérer les contrats avec les prestataires et les fournisseurs.
Coordonner avec les équipes business delivery pour s'assurer que les projets répondent aux besoins métiers.
Servir de point de contact central entre les différents services et les équipes projets.
4. Suivi budgétaire et financier :

Assurer le suivi des budgets alloués aux projets et identifier les écarts par rapport aux prévisions.
Préparer des rapports financiers réguliers pour les comités de pilotage et les décideurs.
Consolider les flash reports et les rapports d'avancement pour le directoire.
Alerter en cas de dépassements budgétaires et proposer des plans de remédiation.
Suivre l'OPEX (dépenses opérationnelles) et s'assurer du respect des engagements financiers.
5. Mise en place de KPI et tableaux de bord :

Définir et mettre en place des indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) pour mesurer l'avancement des projets.
Concevoir et maintenir des tableaux de bord (dashboards) pour visualiser l'état des projets.
Analyser les données pour identifier les tendances, les risques et les opportunités d'amélioration.
Fournir des rapports réguliers aux parties prenantes pour soutenir la prise de décision.
6. Comitologie et organisation des comités :

Préparer et organiser les comités de pilotage (COPIL), les comités de projet (COPRO) et les réunions avec le directoire.
Rédiger les comptes-rendus et assurer le suivi des décisions prises lors des comités.
Coordonner les présentations et les supports nécessaires pour les réunions.
Assurer la diffusion des informations et des décisions aux équipes concernées.
7. Gestion des risques et des alertes :

Identifier, évaluer et suivre les risques liés aux projets infrastructure.
Mettre en place un système d'alertes pour anticiper les dérives (délais, budgets, qualité).
Proposer des plans d'action pour atténuer les risques et résoudre les problèmes.
Assurer un reporting régulier sur l'état des risques et des actions correctives.
8. Suivi de la feuille de route et des engagements :

Suivre l'exécution de la feuille de route infrastructure et s'assurer du respect des engagements.
Coordonner avec les équipes pour ajuster les plannings en fonction des évolutions et des contraintes.
Assurer le suivi des engagements OPEX et proposer des ajustements si nécessaire.
9. Capacity planning et optimisation des ressources :

Mettre en place un capacity planning pour mieux répartir la charge de travail en fonction des capacités des équipes.
Analyser les données de time tracking pour optimiser l'allocation des ressources.
Identifier les surcharges ou les sous-utilisations de ressources et proposer des ajustements.

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

Diplôme de niveau Bac +5 (école de commerce, école d'ingénieur ou université) en gestion de projets, finance ou domaine connexe.
Minimum 8ans dont 5 ans d'expérience en tant que PMO ou dans un rôle similaire, idéalement dans le secteur bancaire et sur des projets infrastructure.
Maîtrise des méthodologies de gestion de projet type : Agile, Scrum, Prince2, Cycle en V.
Connaissance des normes ITIL et des bonnes pratiques de gestion des services IT.
Expérience dans la mise en place de KPI, de tableaux de bord et de systèmes de reporting.
Compréhension des environnements techniques bancaires : virtualisation, réseaux, data center, stockage, sauvegarde, PCA, etc.
Connaissance des architectures techniques et des normes de sécurité informatique.
Maîtrise des outils de gestion de projets (MS Project, Sciforma, etc.) et des outils de reporting (Power BI, Excel, etc.).
Expérience avec les outils de time tracking et de gestion des ressources.
Capacité à suivre et analyser les budgets projets.
Expérience dans la préparation de rapports financiers et l'optimisation des coûts.
Connaissance des concepts OPEX et CAPEX.
Solides compétences en gestion de projets et en suivi budgétaire.
Capacité à travailler en collaboration avec des équipes techniques et métiers.
Excellente communication orale et écrite.
Capacité à analyser des données complexes et à proposer des solutions pragmatiques.
Esprit d'analyse et de synthèse.
Qualités relationnelles et capacité à fédérer les équipes.
Rigueur, organisation et sens de l'anticipation.
Adaptabilité et autonomie.
Orientation client et sens du service.
--

Entre engagement en tant que cabinet de staffing et de recrutement :

Novancy One, cabinet expert leader en recrutement et en staffing de talents dans les domaines des systèmes d'information et de la transformation digitale, s'engage fermement à promouvoir l'égalité et la diversité dans son processus de recrutement. Nous encourageons vivement les candidatures de profils variés, garantissant des opportunités équitables pour tous, quels que soient la race, la couleur, la religion, le genre, l'orientation sexuelle, l'origine nationale, le handicap, l'âge ou le statut d'ancien combattant. Si vous pensez que votre candidature n'a pas été prise en compte, faites-le nous savoir à l'adresse https://novancy.com/contactus. Découvrez nos offres d'emploi actuelles sur https://novancy.com/jobs/ ou soumettez votre CV pour des opportunités futures sur https://novancy.com/cv.
Our commitment as staffing agency:

Novancy One, a leading expert in staffing and recruitment for information systems and digital transformation, is deeply committed to promoting equality and diversity throughout our hiring process. We actively encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, ensuring fair and equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status. Job Description:


Join our dynamic Customer Service Associates team at Arrow! Our team is built on a foundation of collaboration, trust, friendliness, and positivity. If you speak English and enjoy working with others, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!
As part of our company´s growth, ARROW Morocco is strengthening its teams and is looking for a Customer Service Team Leader.
What you will be doing at ARROW


Customer Service Team Leader is responsible for managing a team of Customer Service Representatives (CSR) and overseeing the order to invoice process to meet all related goals and objectives of both, Arrow and our Customer. Team Leader ensures and further develops the right service level to our customers in line with the company goals.
Customer Service Team Leader at Arrow is typically involved in:


· Coaching, training and developing the CSR team,
· Generating KPI’s related to CSR performance metrics, areas for improvement and allocation of resources,
· Managing performance within the team along with annual appraisal for all team members,
· Developing processes and procedures to ensure consistent sales support and customer satisfaction,
· Transition Management,
· Coordinating any Quality issue,
· Managing a team responsible for the following:
· Order to invoice processes,
· Communication with customers, suppliers and delivering after-sales service for business customers (telephone, mail),
· Order Management,
· Close cooperation with other departments like Sales, Asset and Logistics,
· Driving on-time-delivery performance in line with customer and company goals,
· Managing and responding to all requested customer backlog changes,
· Close teamwork with Inside Sales and Product Management,
· Managing customer reserved inventory.
· Typically you would have
3-5 years of previous experience in Customer Service area,


· Advance level of English plus one of the following languages in advance level, Spanish, Italian or French.
· Great communication and coordination skills,
· Good knowledge of MS Office
· Excel Knowledge in advanced level
· Excellent organizational skills and professional “can do & proactive” attitude,
· Ability to handle demanding situations,
· Customer Service oriented mindset, proactive and innovative,
· Supply Chain and people management experience will be an advantage.
· Full Permanent contract,
· Social advantages: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance,
· Very good working atmosphere in a team of passionate collaborators,
· Work culture where you can make an impact,
· Dynamic environment with a friendly work atmosphere,
· Fast recruitment process,
· Interesting career development opportunities in a quickly growing environment,
· Working within an international organization, recognized worldwide in its sector.
Our story


As Arrow Global Components (AGC), a part of Arrow Electronics, we are a leader in distribution and value-added services related to electronic components. We resell, customize, and distribute electronic components to our clients all over the world. Our business is based on a trusted, long-lasting network of relationships with industry leaders, both on the supplier and customer sides.
Arrow is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Job Description:


We're looking for a new person to join our team in Casablanca!
What You’ll Do:


Find and connect with amazing candidates across EMEA for a variety of roles.
Screen applicants and share your insights to help hiring managers make the best decisions.
Build strong relationships with hiring managers, candidates, and the HR team.

Job Description
Participer à la programmation des machines CN selon les besoins de la production
- Capable de modifier et réaliser un programme d'usinage sous TOPSOLID.
- Garantir une coordination avec les programmeurs/ production lors des phases de mises au point en machine.
- Assurer un support technique pour l'utilisation des machines et l'accompagnement des opérateurs machine.
- Analyse des erreurs machines et résolution de problèmes avec les équipes maintenance et programmation FAO.
- Assurer le lien entre les besoins méthodes et la production
- Transmettre les informations clés aux opérateurs lors des réglages et les mises au point sur machine et être en mesure d'assister à une mise au point.
- Sensibiliser et être pédagogique sur l'importance des procédures pour respecter les règles de sécurité et éviter les crash machines



Complementary Description
Connaissances recherchées
Siemens 840D, équivalent niveau P2 (régleur metteur au point)
- Chargement et déchargement de programmes en machine
- Savoir lire du code ISO
- Rentrer des outils dans la machine (jauge, usure, correcteur)
- Autonome sur la manipulation de la machine (menu et sous menu)
- Prise d'origine machine
Utilisation courante du palpage :
- Connaissance des cycles et des paramètres
- Lancement en Manual Data Automatic (MDA)
- Utilisation des fonctions manuelles de définition des origines
- Analyse des message d'erreur machine
- Sauts de blocs en Rappel de Numéro de Séquence (RNS)
- Connaissance de la structure des dossiers de la CN
- Création de variables en Global User Data (GUD)
Connaissances de base en NUM1060 (Optionnel) :
- Environnement CN
- Chargement d'un programme,
- Paramètres et variables
- Savoir dépanner et comprendre la structure des programmes
Connaissances dans un logiciel de CFAO (Catia V5, Topsolid, …)



Job Requirements
Capacités en conduite de machine (suivant descriptif ci-dessus)
Programmation CN et FAO
Expérience de mise en route supérieur à 1an
Esprit d'analyse – Réactif – Rigoureux – Polyvalent
Savoir être pédagogue
Bon niveau en Français écrit et oral

Job Description
Entité:

Au sein du Groupe, Petit Forestier Digital Solutions est le Centre De Services nearshore du groupe Petit Forestier.

Crée en 2017, PFDS accompagne le groupe dans sa transformation digitale en offrant un catalogue de services complet (Support applicatif et infrastructure multi-niveaux, Développement, administration et maintenance des systèmes d'informations groupe, Test et qualité logicielle, BI et Data Quality, Cyber sécurité, Business Process Outsourcing).

Contexte :

Le groupe Petit Forestier est en forte croissance, à la fois organique et externe avec des acquisitions à l’international. Dans ce contexte, le groupe a lancé un programme ambitieux de transformation (TOM). Il intègre un volet système d’information majeur avec l’implémentation de la solution SAP pour remplacer le cœur du système d’information existant.

Vos principales missions seront:


Gestion d’équipe QA, répartir les tâches et préparer un plan de charge


Superviser les tâches de test durant les différentes phases projet


Garantir l’assurance qualité et définir les meilleurs pratiques sur plusieurs projets en parallèle


Conception, rédaction et maintenance des cahiers de tests en coordination avec les Chefs de projets et Product Owners.


Amélioration continue des process QA


Participer à l’élaboration de la stratégie qualité de l’équipe.


Participation active dans l'industrialisation des tests


Exécuter ces tests avec comme objectif de détecter un maximum d’anomalies


Gérer de bout en bout les defects associés aux cas de tests (suivi correction, planning...)


Mener de bout en bout les compagnes de test durant les phases projet


Rédiger des comptes rendus d’activités et des rapports de tests


Profil recherché :


De formation de niveau Bac+5 dans une école d’ingénieur (EMSI, ENSIAS, INSEA, INPT, EMI…) ou master universitaire


Minimum 5ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire


Une certification ISTQB (Fondation, Avanced, Test Manager, Agile Testing) est un atout.


Qualités requises :


Connaissances d’outils de gestion de tests et suivi d’anomalies de type JIRA, XRAY


Expérience en automatisation et développement des scripts automatiques



Être flexible, organisé et méthodique


Capacité de gérer une équipe


Compréhension des enjeux du respect de la stratégie de test


Bonne communication orale et écrite en Français. L’anglais est un plus


Soucis du détail et rigueur permettant d’assurer la qualité des applications testées

job_title: Administrateur Rôles et Autorisations SAP H/F
job_description:
Job Description
PETIT FORESTIER est le leader de la location de matériel frigorifique en Europe.

Créé en 1907 son histoire familiale lui confère une singularité sur le marché qui lui permet d'afficher des chiffres en progression constante : 940 millions d'euros de Chiffre d'Affaires, 5'100 collaborateurs, 300 sites répartis dans 20 pays.

Au sein du Groupe, Petit Forestier Digital Solutions est le Centre De Services nearshore du groupe Petit Forestier.

Crée en 2017, PFDS accompagne le groupe dans sa transformation digitale en offrant un catalogue de services complet (Support applicatif et infrastructure multi-niveaux, Développement, administration et maintenance des systèmes d'informations groupe, Test et qualité logicielle, BI et Data Quality, Cyber sécurité, Business Process Outsourcing)

Pour cette entité, nous recherchons un " Administrateur Rôles et Autorisations SAP (H/F)".

Contexte :
Le groupe Petit Forestier est en forte croissance, à la fois organique et externe avec des acquisitions à l’international. Dans ce contexte, le groupe a lancé un programme ambitieux de transformation (TOM). Il intègre un volet système d’information majeur avec l’implémentation de la solution SAP pour remplacer le cœur du système d’information existant.

Petit Forestier est accompagné d’une assistance à maîtrise d’ouvrage pour construire un modèle opérationnel cible, ainsi que d’un intégrateur SAP pour construire la solution.

Le périmètre SAP couvre les achats, la finance, les contrats, la facturation, la maintenance et la gestion de flotte.

Quel sera votre rôle ?

Vous êtes l'interlocuteur privilégié/Référant pour l'administration des droits SAP sur différents modules : S/4 HANA (FI-CO, SD, MM), FSM (Fleet System Management), SAP Concur

Activités principales :

Définition et maintien de la matrice des rôles et autorisations selon les évolutions des processus métiers en collaboration avec les responsables fonctionnels et experts SAP
Conception, mise en œuvre et évolution des profils utilisateur.
Gestion des rôles simples, dérivés et composites.
Garantir la conformité et le respect des normes
Suivre l'application des notes SAP sécurité en lien avec les autorisations et les outils SAP
Auditer et optimiser les règles liées aux paramètres de sécurité SAP
Mise en place des tests d'intrusion et des contrôles de vulnérabilités du code
Suivi de la sécurisation des bases HANA en termes de gestion des droits et contrôles d’actions sensibles
Assistance aux utilisateurs pour les questions relatives aux autorisations.
Profil et qualifications :

De formation supérieure Bac+5 en informatique
Vous avez une expérience d’au moins 4 ans dans la gestion des autorisations SAP
Connaissances approfondies des aspects liés à la sécurité (confidentialité, sécurisation des systèmes et administration des rôles) et autres solutions de type SIEM et IAM
Compétences techniques et développements selon les technologies (ex ECC, Solutions Manager, dv HANA, Fiori, S4 et BW4HANA)
Être flexible, organisé et méthodique
Capacité de travailler en autonomie et en équipe
Bonne communication orale et écrite en Français. L’anglais est souhaitable

Job Description:


Contract Manager (Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions)


Under the supervision of the EMEA Legal Counsel Director, the Contract Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing the entire contract lifecycle with partners, ensuring compliance and alignment with Arrow's policies and standards.
What You Will Be Doing at Arrow:


Manage and oversee contracts with partners, from negotiation through to execution, ensuring each stage aligns with Arrow’s policies and procedures.
Negotiate contracts in coordination with Arrow's legal counsel and internal teams to ensure the best terms for the company.
Collaborate with key internal stakeholders (Sales, Operations, Tax, Compliance, etc.) to gather necessary inputs during the contract negotiation process.
Ensure that all contracts are aligned with Arrow’s internal policies, standards, and guidelines.
Manage the contract signature process in accordance with Arrow's policies and maintain an organized archive of all contracts in the company’s contract database.
Monitor contract renewal dates and provide timely reminders to relevant teams for renewals.
Respond to partners’ RFPs, questionnaires, and general legal requests, ensuring coordination with relevant internal teams.
Track and monitor contractual performance indicators and ensure regular and accurate reporting.
Fluent in English, with at least 5 years of experience in a Contract Manager role for an international company.
The candidate must have a verifiable legal background and be able to negotiate and draft contracts in English.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
As a true business partner for your stakeholders, you understand the group's commercial challenges and provide your expertise with pragmatism and responsiveness, always maintaining a focus on efficiency and meeting deadlines.
Rigor, responsiveness, interpersonal skills, and a strong sense of analysis and synthesis are essential.
Full-time, permanent contract.
Competitive compensation package with comprehensive social benefits: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment where your contributions will have a meaningful impact.
Opportunity to work within a globally recognized leader in the technology sector, offering growth and career development opportunities.

Job Description:


Business Analyst is a connector between the IT department and business as well as external customers & vendors. The purpose of the role is to provide support to new solutions or processes for development purposes. The person will join the team of Business Analysts reporting to EMEA BTO Business Analyst Manager.


Arrow’s enterprise computing solutions (ECS) business is a global technology enablement company that brings innovative IT solutions to the market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to the world’s leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners that serve commercial and government markets.
Analyzing existing processes and procedure to create, maintain and provide documentation. Specialized engineering projects requiring high level engineering skills and analytical capabilities.
Designing and building automation processes to support sales and operations business.
Testing solutions and performing end users’ validation.
Managing implementation of improvement solution.
Monitoring implemented solutions and propose solutions to improve the level of efficiency.
Provide technical and training support — developing, updating and maintaining instructional documents and process instructions to assist final users.
2-3 years of related experience.
Knowledge of ERP systems will be a plus.
Fluent English.
Great communication and analytical skills.
Permanent contract with 6 months’ probation period
Interesting career development opportunities in a quickly growing environment.
Working with people across the world.

Job Description
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

Babel est une multinationale espagnole qui compte à peu près de 3000 employés dans le monde présente déjà dans 4 continents qui offre des services en technologies nouvelles visant à accompagner les grandes organisations dans leur processus de transformation digitale.

Quel est notre plan stratégique ?

Nous regardons vers l'avenir ! Notre plan stratégique Hyperspace 2029 promet d'être un voyage passionnant, plein d'opportunités de croissance et de développement professionnel. Atteindre un chiffre d'affaires de 1 milliard d'euros, un défi que nous sommes sûrs de relever grâce à la collaboration et au talent de notre équipe, sera une autre histoire de succès que nous écrirons ensemble.

Quel profil nous recherchons?

Nous recherchons un Développeur iOS Senior passionné et expérimenté pour rejoindre notre équipe. Vous travaillerez sur le développement et l'amélioration d'applications mobiles performantes et innovantes, en utilisant les dernières technologies iOS.

Responsabilités
Concevoir, développer et optimiser des applications iOS natives avec Swift.
Assurer la qualité du code en respectant les bonnes pratiques et les principes de développement.
Collaborer avec les designers, les chefs de projet et les autres développeurs pour proposer la meilleure expérience utilisateur.
Intégrer des API et des services backend.
Réaliser des tests unitaires et assurer la correction des bugs.
Participer aux revues de code et proposer des améliorations.
Rester à jour avec les dernières tendances et évolutions de l’écosystème iOS.
Profil recherché
Expérience de 4 ans ou plus en développement iOS.
Excellente maîtrise de Swift et des frameworks iOS (UIKit, SwiftUI, CoreData, etc.).
Expérience avec les architectures MVVM, VIPER ou Clean Architecture.
Connaissance des outils de CI/CD et des tests automatisés.
Expérience avec les bases de données (CoreData, Realm) et l'intégration d'API REST.
Bonne compréhension des principes UX/UI.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à résoudre des problèmes de manière autonome.
#babel

Que proposons-nous ?

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.


Veux-tu faire partie d'une équipe en expansion, engagée et innovante qui fait l'histoire chaque jour ?  Chez Babel, nous t'accompagnons sur le chemin du succès.  Nous croyons au talent des personnes et nous voulons le valoriser en vous offrant un excellent environnement de travail basé sur la collaboration et la solidarité.
Travailler chez Babel, c'est bien plus que travailler dans une entreprise, c'est rejoindre une équipe de personnes avec une mission partagée et un modèle d'entreprise axé sur les valeurs.
De plus,

Nous investissons dans la formation de nos Babelievers.
Nous investissons dans ta santé physique et émotionnelle.  (Assurance Maladie Privée / Assurance Vie, Plan de retraite).
Nous investissons également dans ton temps libre (Team building, Happy Day, AfterWork, Team Day.. )
Nous participons à la croissance de l'entreprise et reconnaissons la contribution de chaque personne (Prime de Bénéfices).
Nous mettons l'accent sur le travail avec les dernières technologies et les projets innovants, mais surtout, nous accompagnons la transformation numérique et rapprochons la technologie de la société.
Acceptes-tu le défi ? Nous t'attendons !

Chez Babel, nous favorisons un environnement de travail basé sur le respect de nos professionnels, le développement professionnel et la promotion de l'égalité des chances sans aucune discrimination.

Conformément à la législation en vigueur en matière de protection des données, nous vous informons que le GRUPO BABEL est responsable de vos données personnelles (voir les entreprises dans la politique de confidentialité), et qu'il les utilisera pour gérer vos processus de sélection, actuels et futurs, ainsi que pour les autres finalités décrites sur le site web. Ce traitement est basé sur le consentement du candidat. Les données personnelles collectées ne seront en aucun cas transférées à des tiers, sauf en cas d'obligations légales expresses. Vous pouvez exercer vos droits en matière de protection des données à l'adresse suivante : data.protection@babelgroup.com. Toutes les informations sur la politique de confidentialité sont disponibles sur notre site web.

Job Description
Quality Engineer

Help shape the future of mobility.

Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv’s passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Position Summary

Direct and supervise all product quality control and manufacturing process activities performed by the audit team and issue audit action plans to improve established quality ratios and achieve expected quality.

Your Role

As a Quality  Engineer, you will be in charge of these various accountabilities:

 Ensure the processing of customer complaints in collaboration with other departments;
 Oversee the application of EOS systems and procedures;
 Analyze the customer's product quality requirements;
 Ensure the management of customer complaints;
 Evaluate the manufacturing process in collaboration with the Engineering Department;
 Inform the engineers of the Engineering Department of any anomalies and decide on corrective actions in collaboration with them;
Your Background

Bac+5 / Engineering degree in a technical education (or equivalent)
Advanced English is mandatory
Knowledge of manufacturing process
Strong analytical and synthesis skills
Problem solving techniques
Why join us?

You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health.
Apply today, and together let’s change tomorrow!

What will your story be? Apply now!

Business Development Manager

We are looking for a Business Development Manager for a position located in the east region (Fez) and reporting to Sales & Trade Marketing Manager.

The Ideal candidate will be responsible within his assigned region, for the achievement of pre-defined Sales & Distribution (S&D) key targets.

What you will be doing:

As a Business Development Manager, you will:

Manage and strengthen the relationship with the local distributor, ensuring effective coordination, KPI monitoring, and efficient distribution of JTI Brands.
Lead and support the distributor in achieving distribution targets, monitor stock levels, contribute to objective setting, and drive JTI Brands performance.
Manage the Trade Loyalty Program, ensuring its efficient execution at regional level Monitoring performance and ROI
Supervise at regional level, the execution of the consumers programs and activities:
Develop, Implement & monitor S&D plans and initiatives,
Provide the Management with daily/weekly updates in regard to sales and market development/evolution at regional Level.
Requirements:

University degree in business administration
Fluent in French, English & Arabic. "Berber" would be an appreciated plus
4-6 years experience in Sales & Distribution/Distributor Management/Channel management/Trade marketing & Implementation of consumer and costumer Programs.Experience in Brand Management is a plus.

Oriented attitude towards consumer and customer service
